Recon Patroller.name: Recon Patroller
Recon Patroller.description:
Some forests are protected by kings, others only by wild things. Laws against hunting may protect the private reserves of nobles or guard the viability of animal populations of shared forests during specific seasons. Poachers violate those laws- sometimes out of greed, sometimes out of desperation, and sometimes for sport. Although penalties against poaching often include public shaming, in lean times a successful poacher is a local hero.

From the managed and cultivated forests that support villages to the tree-covered crown lands where only nobles and their servants are permitted to hunt, forests provide. To communities, forests provide fuel, food, medicine, and raw materials, while royally protected forests provide food for the nobles' table and a source of entertainment in the form of organized hunts. Even the ancient woods untouched by mortal hand or blade provide bards with settings where legends happened and could happen again. Many find the forest depths unsettling, but others live their lives among the trees and alongside the creatures that make their homes there.

q8RnxJPpBW9f5Ie5.name: Forager
q8RnxJPpBW9f5Ie5.description: While using Survival to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.49y9Ec4bDii8pcD3]{Subsist}, if the recon patroller rolls a failure or a critical failure, they get a success instead. If the recon patroller rolls a success, they can provide food for 4 additional creatures that eat about as much as a human, or 8 creatures on a critical success.

SjfWr7t0YSZQdt8c.name: Snare Crafting
SjfWr7t0YSZQdt8c.description:
The recon patroller can use the Crafting skill to create the following snares:

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.AFX1V0Go9DqPWBlN]{Alarm Snare}
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Km4lSOsyrip5q6iD]{Hampering Snare}
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.oplQpQSTyTvHDDtq]{Marking Snare}
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.XcD8p1o71tPohZWT]{Signaling Snare}

The recon patroller can create four snares each day without paying for the materials, using 3 Interact actions to set up each snare.

rTeH6wIQdfQpy5CH.name: Hunt Prey
rTeH6wIQdfQpy5CH.description: The recon patroller designates a single creature they can see and hear, or one they're Tracking, as their prey. The recon patroller gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} the prey and to Survival checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Track} the prey. The first time the recon patroller hits the designated prey in a round, they deal an additional 1d8 precision damage. The recon patroller also ignores the penalty for making ranged attacks within their second range increment. These effects last until the recon patroller uses Hunt Prey again.

nl5KPflk4q23U2l3.name: Construct Armor (Hardness 2)
nl5KPflk4q23U2l3.description: Like normal objects, an animated dagger has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage the dagger takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once an animated dagger is reduced to fewer than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks, and its Armor Class is reduced to 14.

Pappy Draighean.name: Pappy Draighean
Pappy Draighean.description:
Leprechauns are mostly jovial tricksters who prefer mischief over conflict. They fill their days with as much fun, wine, and food as possible. Mostly found in forested regions, leprechauns respect nature and those who protect it.

Leprechauns do not attack on sight. Rather, they engage in conversation and try to charm, cajole, or trick those they meet into doing favors for them or freely giving over a treasured item, usually in return for illusory wealth or false promises of wealth and success. These small tricksters are masters at discerning the desires of those they meet-a knack that puts them in a powerful position when bargaining for goods or favors. They aren't above turning people against each other for their own benefit but generally not to an extent that causes harm.

In most cases, a leprechaun doesn't keep a purloined possession for long. The leprechaun most often returns such stolen prizes just in time to defuse tensions, often as they point out the humor of the situation, hoping to share their amusement and mirth with the victim. In cases where a leprechaun's trick goes too far and results in an incensed victim, the leprechaun quickly flees the conflict rather than engage in combat. This willingness to return stolen goods or to flee from battles fades as leprechauns grow older. Ancient leprechauns who have lived for thousands of years often spiral into dark bitterness and increasingly use their powers and illusions to lure those who offend them or fail to appreciate a joke into danger... or even death.

qZaBb2z6mE2zLL2u.name: Create Object
qZaBb2z6mE2zLL2u.description:
Frequency three times per day

Effect The leprechaun produces an item out of their hat, from behind their jacket, from within a hole in a tree stump, or from any other unexpected location. This conjured item must be no more than 1 Bulk and must be made of relatively commonplace material (such as cloth, wood, stone, or even low-value metal like iron or lead). It can't rely on intricate artistry or complex moving parts, never fulfills a Cost or the like, and can't be made of precious materials or materials with a rarity of uncommon or higher.

The created object is temporary and lasts for 1 hour or until the leprechaun creates a new item, whichever comes first.

ixXRVHF3jg0IMuKw.name: Leprechaun Magic
ixXRVHF3jg0IMuKw.description: When a leprechaun uses their innate spells to deceive, trick, or humiliate a creature, the spell DC increases to 22 and the attack modifier to +13.

lwXqQ02Y4ZMHsusu.name: Bloodletting
lwXqQ02Y4ZMHsusu.description: When the witch's gaze deals piercing or slashing damage to an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} target, they also deal 1 persistent bleed damage.

Harpy Forager.name: Harpy Forager
Harpy Forager.description:
Harpies are filthy amalgamations of human and bird, resembling feral humans with wings, talons, and mouths full of sharp teeth. They use captivating songs to lure creatures in, then murder them while they stand transfixed. They enjoy causing confusion and fear in their prey before they strike, believing it creates a savory flavor in the flesh. Harpies can eat most creatures but strongly prefer sapient prey-humans and elves are their favorite. Although harpies will eat goblins if sufficiently hungry, they dislike their flavor and avoid eating them if possible. This doesn't comfort goblins, of course, who have a particularly strong fear of harpies. Because their aeries often reek with the gore of their kills and careless spatters of guano, harpies carry a distinctly vile scent that canny travelers associate with danger. Harpies who roost close to civilization make better efforts to keep clean, though these efforts have mixed results.

Harpies live in family groups or larger clans. They are lightweight despite their size, standing 5 feet tall and weighing only around 90 pounds. While most use relatively simple weapons, some harpies take pride in learning and mastering the use of more complex tools of war such as swords and slings. Those who master the use of the bow, in particular, are often regarded as heroes among their kind and terrors among their victims.

NQF0fD75864Ytav1.name: Captivating Song
NQF0fD75864Ytav1.description:
The harpy cries out an eerie, compelling melody. Each non-harpy creature within a @Template[emanation|distance:300]{300-foot aura} must attempt a @Check[will|dc:24] save to avoid becoming captivated by the harpy's song. The effect lasts for 1 round, but if the harpy uses this ability again on subsequent rounds, it extends the duration by 1 round for all affected creatures. Once a creature succeeds at any save against Captivating Song, that creature is temporarily immune to Captivating Songs for 24 hours.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated}, and it must spend each of its actions to move closer to the harpy as expediently as possible, while avoiding obvious dangers. If a captivated creature is adjacent to the harpy, it stays still and doesn't act. If attacked by the harpy, the creature is freed from captivation at the end of the harpy's turn.

Critical Failure As failure, but if attacked by the harpy, the creature can attempt a new save at the start of its next turn, rather than being freed at the end of the harpy's turn.

g2SVVtNILSvWr6mT.name: Disorienting Shriek
g2SVVtNILSvWr6mT.description:
Effect The harpy forager emits a shrill screech. Each non-harpy creature within a @Template[burst|distance:30] must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:24] save. Once a creature succeeds at any save against Disorienting Shriek, that creature is temporarily immune to Disorienting Shrieks for 24 hours.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is clumsy 1 for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for 1 minute.

Dorenea.name: Dorenea
Dorenea.description: Simple to create and varied in purpose, these shambling undead are often used for their strength and endless stamina to conduct boring, repetitive tasks.

UHjOHKWLHa1xT8ID.name: Slow
UHjOHKWLHa1xT8ID.description: Dorenea is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

7rpcLcKUwgjQVUST.name: Sneak Attack
7rpcLcKUwgjQVUST.description: Dorenea zombie deals an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

b4ti2yqe9ipiuxz2.name: Sudden Surge
b4ti2yqe9ipiuxz2.description:
Trigger Dorenea's turn begins

Effect Dorenea has a sudden burst of speed. They are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} this turn and can use the extra action only to Stride or Strike. If Dorenea's first action this turn is a melee Strike, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the attack.

Dorenea can't use Sudden Surge for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge]]{1d4 rounds}.

N0tgCmFV3Bvn8ZfA.name: Lay Down Your Lives
N0tgCmFV3Bvn8ZfA.description:
Trigger An ally within 30 feet of the witch's talon takes Hit Point damage

Effect The ally takes half of the Hit Point damage, and the witch's talon takes the remainder of the damage.

Elite Combustive Zombie.name: Elite Combustive Zombie
Elite Combustive Zombie.description:
Glowing with a dull amber light, these odious creatures spawn from a combination of necromancy and fire. These destructive creations sow chaos and demolish fortifications, making them the bane of besieged cities.

Necromancers most often create these mindless undead as obedient, expendable servitors. Left to its own devices, a zombie seeks only to consume the living, stopping only when its rotting body can no longer hold together.

iFKv7PFNKtSVy9XA.name: Slow
iFKv7PFNKtSVy9XA.description: A combustive zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

td3gay0LzawYp5Ff.name: Death Throes
td3gay0LzawYp5Ff.description: When a combustive zombie dies, its body explodes in a @Template[burst|distance:30] of fire and debris that deals @Damage[(3d10+2)[bludgeoning],(3d10+2)[fire]]{3d10 + 2 bludgeoning damage and 3d10 + 2 fire damage} to each creature in the area (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic] save).

0eyOInV05vjoOU3X.name: Blinding Sulfur
0eyOInV05vjoOU3X.description: A combustive zombie burns with putrid inner fire. A creature hit by a combustive zombie's fist Strike must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:27] save. On a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round, or for 1 minute on a critical failure.

7t0hoAr4rbWswzMK.name: Barbed Quills
7t0hoAr4rbWswzMK.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger Liaskra is hit with an unarmed Strike or a Strike with a non-reach melee weapon

Effect Liaskra breaks off quills in her attacker's flesh. She deals @Damage[1d8[piercing]] damage to the triggering creature (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic]). On a critical failure, the creature also takes @Damage[1d4[bleed]] damage as the quills hook into their flesh.

LHV1Y69RCdChvRwx.name: Trick Attack
LHV1Y69RCdChvRwx.description: Liaskra musters her guile to attempt a clever attack that catches her foe unprepared. Liaskra chooses one of her weapons. The next attack with that weapon deals an extra 1d6 precision damage. In addition, Liaskra can Interact to draw the weapon (or to reload it if she chooses the hand crossbow).

IxZJIkZ5XQ9BwO3l.name: Accursed Claws
IxZJIkZ5XQ9BwO3l.description: Sounrel's claws carry her mother's hag magic. When she critically hits with a claw Strike, the target takes an additional @Damage[1d4[persistent,mental]] damage.

Ambush Assassin.name: Ambush Assassin
Ambush Assassin.description:
Assassins commit murder, either for pay or due to their belief in a cause, such as a religion or a political movement. Some assassins work alone and choose their own victims. Others are members of assassins' guilds, organizations that accept contracts to kill in return for money, favors, or both.

Some criminals are the desperate who have no option but to break the law to survive, while others choose a life of crime for thrills, forming gangs or underworld guilds that specialize in certain illegal ventures.

2w1WQr635JVnsORb.name: Swift Sneak
2w1WQr635JVnsORb.description: The assassin can move their full speed when @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneaking}.

zeH3OrBLioIRoYb5.name: Deny Advantage
zeH3OrBLioIRoYb5.description: The assassin isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to creatures of 8th level or lower that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected}, flanking or using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.w6rMqmGzhUahdnA7]{Surprise Attack}.

EfyjTBD4oU2iR2LU.name: Nimble Dodge
EfyjTBD4oU2iR2LU.description:
Trigger A creature targets you with an attack and you can see the attacker.

Requirements You are not encumbered

You deftly dodge out of the way, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

cYpzRpaINHeW2XxC.name: Poison Weapon
cYpzRpaINHeW2XxC.description:
Requirements The assassin is wielding a piercing or slashing weapon and has a free hand.

Effect The assassin applied a poison to the weapon.

kzNiR7bLBxL4aWfR.name: Quick Draw
kzNiR7bLBxL4aWfR.description: The assassin @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pvQ5rY2zrtPI614F]{Interacts} to draw a weapon, then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VjxZFuUXrCU94MWR]{Strikes} with that weapon.

ld6AdRlIeDnctV9m.name: Sneak Attack
ld6AdRlIeDnctV9m.description: The assassin deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

t5skSqnTS4aKuuan.name: Surprise Attack
t5skSqnTS4aKuuan.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the assassin.

rm5sOGU46Lbwed4O.name: Aldori Parry
rm5sOGU46Lbwed4O.description: Thisnabel gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of their next turn.

sqsHfPzCBU6rGYz1.name: Sneak Attack
sqsHfPzCBU6rGYz1.description: Thisnabel deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

F44pNDrMtxw9rISh.name: Spellstrike
F44pNDrMtxw9rISh.description: Nathatel channels a spell into a melee attack to deliver a magically charged attack. He Casts a Spell that takes 1 or 2 actions to cast and requires a spell attack roll. The effects of the spell don't occur immediately but are imbued into his attack instead. He makes a melee Strike with a weapon or unarmed attack, which gains the arcane trait. His spell is coupled with the attack, using his attack roll to determine the effects of both the Strike and the spell. This counts as two attacks for his multiple attack penalty, but the penalty isn't applied until after he has completed the Spellstrike. After he uses Spellstrike, Nathatel can't do so again until he recharges this ability as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. He also recharges his Spellstrike when he casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9mPEoOPN0AMuixIv]{Force Fang} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r82rqcm0MmGaBFkM]{Thunderous Strike}.

VbgZjrnZjU4M7aIV.name: Burrowing Viper Rat Venom
VbgZjrnZjU4M7aIV.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:16]

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d8[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Elite Smokesight Deadeye Wight.name: Elite Smokesight Deadeye Wight
Elite Smokesight Deadeye Wight.description:
Dangers deep in the wilderness claim the life some lone scout or hunter. When they arise as wights, they renew their hunt with equal vigor, but all the living are now their prey. Hunter wights prefer to seek strategic ground, frequently taking residence atop hills or within abandoned watchtowers and keeps.

Wights are undead beings of spite who primarily stalk places related to death.

TOApogIgln0yhGda.name: Smoke Vision
TOApogIgln0yhGda.description: The deadeye wight ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

479508pjo4uznsty.name: Final Snare
479508pjo4uznsty.description:
Trigger The deadeye wight is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect The deadeye wight has rigged their own body with a snare, which they trigger before being destroyed. Slivers of bone launch at an adjacent creature, dealing @Damage[(4d8+4)[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:27|basic]).

3gvb9wq37oq21be3.name: Drain Life
3gvb9wq37oq21be3.description: When the deadeye wight damages a living creature using an unarmed attack or their bound weapon, they gain 10 temporary Hit Points, and the creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:27] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. Further damage dealt by the deadeye wight's unarmed and bound weapon attacks increases the value of the drained condition by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of drained 4.

4z31tccif8f7qaq7.name: Spawn Deadeye Wight
4z31tccif8f7qaq7.description: A living humanoid killed by a deadeye wight's weapon or claw Strike rises as a deadeye wight spawn after [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. This spawn is under the command of the deadeye wight that killed them. They don't have drain life or spawn deadeye wight and are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for as long as they're a deadeye wight spawn. If the creator of the deadeye wight spawn dies, the deadeye wight spawn becomes a fully autonomous deadeye wight; they regain their free will, gain drain life and spawn deadeye wight, and are no longer clumsy.

Meddlesome Scrit.name: Meddlesome Scrit
Meddlesome Scrit.description:
Scrits are short, spindly gremlins with gray or beige leathery skin and a coat of smeared ink on their fingers. They make themselves the nightmare of many scribes and librarians, as they delight in nothing more than destroying books, scrolls, artwork, and other records or writing. The oils on a scrit's skin smears ink and renders text-even magical writing-completely illegible. Once they have smeared every page of a book, scrits devour them whole, absorbing the contents the book used to hold. After eating books they find stupid or funny, scrits hold skits for other gremlins which mock the mortal authors for the amusement of the other fey.

Gremlins are malicious fey that infest and prey upon mortal communities. They live in tunnels, beneath eaves, and in abandoned buildings, stealing what they need from their neighbors instead of creating for themselves.

While there are gremlins of any and every gender, their appearances don't differ by gender. Young gremlins grow to maturity with alarming speed. Their entire nest raises them communally, though they are often encouraged to wander unsupervised and create mischief away from home instead of inside it.

a0Y3uV615pfpXjsl.name: Nasty Ink
a0Y3uV615pfpXjsl.description:
A scrit's fingers are perpetually covered in smeared ink from the writing it's destroyed. This ink mixes with its skin oils to create a disgusting, sticky poison.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:14]

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d4[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (1 round)

48Y9uY1twqYCaXUZ.name: Smear Text
48Y9uY1twqYCaXUZ.description: The scrit rubs its fingers against one page of writing, smearing the text and rendering it unreadable. The scrit can smear and destroy magical writing such as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.o0l57UfBm9ScEUMW]{Rune Trap} or a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.AUctDF2fqPZN2w4W]{Sigil} by succeeding at a counteract check (using the scrit's [[/r 1d20+8]]{spell attack modifier}) against the caster's DC.

Elven Hunter.name: Elven Hunter
Elven Hunter.description:
As is reflected in the many depictions of an elk-headed Erastil, god of the hunt, the hunter is very much a creature of the forest, known by the forest and familiar with every aspect of it. After all, the final determination of who is the hunter and who is prey often depends on who is able to make an ally of the terrain.

From the managed and cultivated forests that support villages to the tree-covered crown lands where only nobles and their servants are permitted to hunt, forests provide. To communities, forests provide fuel, food, medicine, and raw materials, while royally protected forests provide food for the nobles' table and a source of entertainment in the form of organized hunts. Even the ancient woods untouched by mortal hand or blade provide bards with settings where legends happened and could happen again. Many find the forest depths unsettling, but others live their lives among the trees and alongside the creatures that make their homes there.

sw2mWVFaQb93J9el.name: Forager
sw2mWVFaQb93J9el.description: While using Survival to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.49y9Ec4bDii8pcD3]{Subsist}, if the tracker rolls a failure or a critical failure, they get a success instead. If the tracker rolls a success, they can provide food for 16 additional creatures that eat about as much as a human, or 32 creatures on a critical success.

xeEI4dqDE4PmxOeA.name: Forest Walker
xeEI4dqDE4PmxOeA.description: The hunter ignores the effects of difficult terrain from a forest environment. They can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} through underbrush without the need to attempt a Stealth check as long as the hunter moves no more than 5 feet at a time and is not within 10 feet of an enemy at any point during their movement.

ImzpAPq1SgMcf7t3.name: Hunt Prey
ImzpAPq1SgMcf7t3.description:
The hunter designates a single creature they can see and hear, or one they're Tracking, as their prey. The hunter gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} the prey and to Survival checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Track} the prey.

The first time the hunter hits the designated prey in a round, they deal an additional 1d8 precision damage. The hunter also ignores the penalty for making ranged attacks within their second range increment.

These effects last until the hunter uses Hunt Prey again.

Skeletal Pathfinder Veteran.name: Skeletal Pathfinder Veteran
Skeletal Pathfinder Veteran.description:
These skeletons retain the cunning they possessed in life.

Made from bones held together by foul necromancy, skeletons are among the most common types of undead, found haunting old dungeons and forgotten cemeteries.

Elven Grave Robber.name: Elven Grave Robber
Elven Grave Robber.description:
Many cultures have a tradition of burying their dead with a selection of the deceased's most precious possessions, and some include gifts that are thought to provide a boon in the afterlife. Such valuables can be easy pickings for those with no respect for-or fear of-the dead.

Some criminals are the desperate who have no option but to break the law to survive, while others choose a life of crime for thrills, forming gangs or underworld guilds that specialize in certain illegal ventures.

Mlr3n6w8aB9t1a5K.name: Infused Items
Mlr3n6w8aB9t1a5K.description:
A grave robber carries the following infused items: 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.AFR01HVd7DcZvkpP]{Bottled Lightning (Lesser)}, a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.EpxmUtLpCkE8R6KJ]{Frost Vial (Lesser)}, and a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Xnqglykl3Cif8rN9]{Thunderstone (Lesser)}.

These items last for 24 hours, or until the next time the grave robber makes their daily preparations.

Smokesight Deadeye Wight.name: Smokesight Deadeye Wight
Smokesight Deadeye Wight.description:
Dangers deep in the wilderness claim the life some lone scout or hunter. When they arise as wights, they renew their hunt with equal vigor, but all the living are now their prey. Hunter wights prefer to seek strategic ground, frequently taking residence atop hills or within abandoned watchtowers and keeps.

Wights are undead beings of spite who primarily stalk places related to death.

TOApogIgln0yhGda.name: Smoke Vision
TOApogIgln0yhGda.description: The deadeye wight ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

479508pjo4uznsty.name: Final Snare
479508pjo4uznsty.description:
Trigger The deadeye wight is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect The deadeye wight has rigged their own body with a snare, which they trigger before being destroyed. Slivers of bone launch at an adjacent creature, dealing @Damage[4d8[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic]).

3gvb9wq37oq21be3.name: Drain Life
3gvb9wq37oq21be3.description: When the deadeye wight damages a living creature using an unarmed attack or their bound weapon, they gain 9 temporary Hit Points, and the creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:25] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. Further damage dealt by the deadeye wight's unarmed and bound weapon attacks increases the value of the drained condition by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of drained 4.

4z31tccif8f7qaq7.name: Spawn Deadeye Wight
4z31tccif8f7qaq7.description: A living humanoid killed by a deadeye wight's weapon or claw Strike rises as a deadeye wight spawn after [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. This spawn is under the command of the deadeye wight that killed them. They don't have drain life or spawn deadeye wight and are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for as long as they're a deadeye wight spawn. If the creator of the deadeye wight spawn dies, the deadeye wight spawn becomes a fully autonomous deadeye wight; they regain their free will, gain drain life and spawn deadeye wight, and are no longer clumsy.

nl5KPflk4q23U2l3.name: Construct Armor (Hardness 2)
nl5KPflk4q23U2l3.description: Like normal objects, an animated dagger has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage the dagger takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once an animated dagger is reduced to fewer than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks, and its Armor Class is reduced to 14.

Elven Tracker.name: Elven Tracker
Elven Tracker.description:
The forest offers dangerous creatures-whether they walk on four legs or two-a place to hide. Dim light, low brush, and fallen leaves conspire to hide their trails. Given these poor conditions, an unskilled eye might spot a sign or two of a creature's passing, but only a skilled tracker can identify several such signs and discern their relationship to each other, connecting one to the next until they form a trail of prints, scat, fur, feathers, and blood that leads to the quarry's lair.

From the managed and cultivated forests that support villages to the tree-covered crown lands where only nobles and their servants are permitted to hunt, forests provide. To communities, forests provide fuel, food, medicine, and raw materials, while royally protected forests provide food for the nobles' table and a source of entertainment in the form of organized hunts. Even the ancient woods untouched by mortal hand or blade provide bards with settings where legends happened and could happen again. Many find the forest depths unsettling, but others live their lives among the trees and alongside the creatures that make their homes there.

GxVV9OrtL5eoSx2b.name: Forager
GxVV9OrtL5eoSx2b.description: While using Survival to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.49y9Ec4bDii8pcD3]{Subsist}, if the elven tracker rolls a failure or a critical failure, they get a success instead. If the elven tracker rolls a success, they can provide food for 16 additional creatures that

tWDvrIy7tMRedOAa.name: Master Tracker
tWDvrIy7tMRedOAa.description: The elven tracker can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Track} while moving at full speed.

5qtQA0th9HWkfecU.name: Hunt Prey
5qtQA0th9HWkfecU.description: The elven tracker designates a single creature they can see and hear, or one they're Tracking, as their prey. The elven tracker gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} the prey and to Survival checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Track} the prey. The first time the elven tracker hits the designated prey in a round, they deal an additional 1d8 precision damage. The elven tracker also ignores the penalty for making ranged attacks within their second range increment. These effects last until the elven tracker uses Hunt Prey again.

Mutant Shadow Drake.name: Mutant Shadow Drake
Mutant Shadow Drake.description: Shadow drakes are typically among the smallest and least powerful of their species. Most stand as tall and long as house cats and have charcoal-colored scales and membranous wings just translucent enough to pass for shadows. Attracted to shiny materials, they employ deception, teamwork, and even rudimentary traps to create opportunities to make off with ill-gotten gains. Shadow drakes have a particular fascination and admiration for umbral dragons-a notable exception to the norm for drakes and dragons.

QNy9Hrx2ib5tkQKt.name: Shadow Blend
QNy9Hrx2ib5tkQKt.description: The shadow drake's form shifts and blends reflexively with surrounding shadows. A shadow drake gains an additional reaction each round, but it can use this reaction only for Shadow Evade.

0VNX7MbrCqRSKYkE.name: Shadow Evade
0VNX7MbrCqRSKYkE.description:
Trigger A creature attacks the shadow drake while it is in an area of dim light

Effect The shadow drake further obscures its position. The attacker must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:11] check in order to affect the shadow drake, as if the drake were @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} for the triggering attack.

wnZi8QCOMG86Db4l.name: Draconic Frenzy
wnZi8QCOMG86Db4l.description: The shadow drake makes one bite Strike and two tail Strikes in any order.

usIKpszaYrCWfN8r.name: Shadow Breath
usIKpszaYrCWfN8r.description:
A shadow drake spits a ball of black liquid that explodes into a cloud of frigid black shadow. This attack has a range of 40 feet and explodes in a 5-foot-radius burst. Creatures within the burst take @Damage[(3d6+4)[cold]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic] save). The explosion of shadow also snuffs out mundane light sources the size of a torch, lantern, or smaller, and attempts to counteract magical light with a +10 counteract modifier.

The shadow drake can't use Shadow Breath again for [[/r 1d6]] rounds.

5IixHzakyftZgS0g.name: Speed Surge
5IixHzakyftZgS0g.description:
Frequency three times per day

Effect The shadow drake Strides or Flies twice.

Weak Clacking Skull Swarm.name: Weak Clacking Skull Swarm
Weak Clacking Skull Swarm.description:
Roiling about in seething waves of bleached death, clacking skull swarms arise from the remains of dozens of beheaded humanoids. The horrible clattering of the skulls' onslaught drives their prey to distraction even while they try to flee in terror.

A skull swarm is composed of reanimated masses of craniums and jawbones, forming a terrifying avalanche of undead fury. Most skull swarms are mindless, though some retain a vestige of wit, awareness, and even magical talents from life, culminating in a highly intelligent swarm mind.

YXFicpAJz9WZdrnS.name: Boneshard Burst
YXFicpAJz9WZdrnS.description: When a clacking skull swarm is reduced to 0 Hit Points, it erupts in an explosion of foul energy and bone fragments in a @Template[burst|distance:30], dealing @Damage[(2d12-2)[piercing],(2d12-2)[void]|options:area-damage]{2d12-2 piercing damage and 2d12-2 void damage} (@Check[reflex|dc:27|basic|options:area-effect] save).

dhMEgZcYzpqH15gY.name: Chattering Teeth
dhMEgZcYzpqH15gY.description: 60 feet. A clacking skull swarm emits a cacophony of chattering. A creature entering or beginning its turn within the area must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:27] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round. A creature that successfully saves is immune to that swarm's chattering teeth for 24 hours. The swarm can stop or resume this ability as a free action.

vAYa9X9DeqTHfehJ.name: Shrieking Scream
vAYa9X9DeqTHfehJ.description:
The clacking skull swarm emits a terrifying, painful scream that deals @Damage[(10d6-4)[sonic]] damage to all creatures in a @Template[cone|distance:30] (@Check[will|dc:27|basic] save). A creature that fails this save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure).

The swarm can't use Frightening Scream again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Shrieking Scream]]{1d4 rounds}.

CFiD5D2XvZ2N67x1.name: Swarming Gnaw
CFiD5D2XvZ2N67x1.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[(4d8-2)[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:27|basic] save).

Dream of Doom.name: Dream of Doom
Dream of Doom.description:
An animate dream coalesces from centuries of stray fragments of reverie and dream left behind as slumbering minds drift through the Dimension of Dreams. In most cases, these fragments simply disperse on their own, but when dreamers flee from nightmares back to the waking world, these fragments can take on a supernatural life of their own. They have little reasoning and intent except to seek similar fragments, absorb them, and grow. When enough of them gather together, they merge into a horrific form as an animate dream.

Individually, animate dreams can hold a wide range of appearances, but most take on rudimentary shapes akin to the living forms of the minds that spawned them. Animate dreams that rise from slumbering humanoids, the most commonly encountered, thus appear humanoid, but with distorted, nightmarish shapes that incorporate additional twisted limbs and frightening features. In these forms, animate dreams find their way out of the Dreamlands and into the waking world, only to discover they have no way of returning and suffer a relentless hunger that only new nightmares can sate.

An animate dream thrives on the terror fueled by nightmares and fear and uses its supernatural abilities to invoke such feelings in the minds of its victims, cursing its prey by creating a permanent link to that individual's dreams. Thereafter, the victim is subjected to all manner of reoccurring nightmares. As the nightmares continue, the victim finds it more and more difficult to remain awake. In the end, the victim plunges into an accursed slumber from which it cannot return. These victims provide the animate dream with the purest form of fear and are its preferred sustenance.

An animate dream can subsist on the ambient fear generated by regular nightmares, but these lesser fears aren't as satisfying, often driving the animate dream to seek out new victims. Left without a source of fear, an animate dream won't starve to death, but it will grow increasingly violent and desperate. Famished animate dreams are the ones most often encountered, as they have been forced to abandon subtlety to pursue more blatant methods of harvesting fear. Yet such animate dreams also tend to be the least powerful of their kind. Those who have grown metaphysically fat on fear have generally done so by adopting a specific nightmare theme, such as being buried alive, being swept away by ocean waves, or being consumed by wild beasts. Such animate dreams often have similarly themed innate spells to augment their powers.

hychIP30Jt5HOYED.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

elheymEXlGDDgeU9.name: Imminent Demise
elheymEXlGDDgeU9.description: 15 feet. Creatures within the aura experience an acute awareness of their own mortality, and are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} for as long as they remain within the aura. Creatures with the dream trait are immune to this ability.

pepIdjNqJtUTl9Wn.name: Endless Nightmare
pepIdjNqJtUTl9Wn.description:
An animate dream's touch fills the victim's mind with terrifying visions

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:24]

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} (1 day)

Stage 2 fatigued and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 The victim falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} and can't be awakened as long as they remain at this stage (1 day).

lwXqQ02Y4ZMHsusu.name: Bloodletting
lwXqQ02Y4ZMHsusu.description: When the witch's eye deals piercing or slashing damage to an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} target, they also deal 1 persistent bleed damage.

Coven Winter Hag.name: Coven Winter Hag
Coven Winter Hag.description:
On long, dark winter nights, folk at the edges of civilization have learned to be wary of old women who come knocking at their door. They look for her tracks in the snow and other telltale signs to make sure she isn't a winter hag who plans to drag them off and feast on their bones.

In truth, winter hags are more subtle monsters, entrapping humanoids in schemes that create mistrust and anger within a village before picking off the residents one or two at a time, heightening the fear and anger of those who remain. When her work is done, a winter hag revels in the silence of a frost-rimed village in which no hearth fires are left burning.

Foul creatures who appear as wizened old women, hags share little in common with the humanoids they terrorize. They are hateful entities whose greatest joy lies in the corruption and ultimate destruction of anything good and virtuous. Whatever power created the first hags is lost to time, but numerous hag varieties have arisen over the ages, each with their own powers and abilities to spread pain and suffering.

vpKKf7MXtmLs5zCF.name: Coven
vpKKf7MXtmLs5zCF.description:
A winter hag adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.3puDanGfpEt6jK5k]{Cone of Cold}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.piMJO6aYeDJbrhEo]{Solid Fog}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.R5FHRv7VqyRnxg2t]{Wall of Ice} to her coven's spells.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Coven]

9FrKdx9Hv7Nqbxqh.name: Snow Vision
9FrKdx9Hv7Nqbxqh.description: Snow doesn't impair a winter hag's vision; she ignores @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealment} from snowfall.

Zylzzu3xfzA6axxc.name: Craft Ice Staff
Zylzzu3xfzA6axxc.description: A winter hag can spend 1 day performing a specific ritual to create a +1 Striking Staff of black ice. Once per day, she can use the staff to cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.3puDanGfpEt6jK5k]{Cone of Cold}. The staff's magic functions only in the hands of the hag who created it; for anyone else, it is a mundane staff. If the hag dies or if the staff remains in another creature's possession for 24 hours, the staff melts into a puddle of foul-smelling water.

3r5kNijs14DNKRqh.name: Ice Climb
3r5kNijs14DNKRqh.description: A winter hag can Climb at the listed Speed, but only on ice. She ignores difficult terrain from ice and snow, and she doesn't risk falling when crossing ice.

Serraleth.name: Serraleth
Serraleth.description: Rorus, sometimes called hunter demons, are brutal fiends that arise from the souls of mortals who mutilated animal corpses. As demons, these individuals don animal pelts, then infiltrate packs or herds to corrupt entire swaths of animals, turning their victims bloodthirsty and feral.

lo4ykwnhgn0sqzrn.name: Disobedience Vulnerability
lo4ykwnhgn0sqzrn.description: The first time each round an attempt to Command an Animal fails within 60 feet of Serraleth, she takes @Damage[4d6[mental]] damage (@Damage[10d6[mental]] if Serraleth failed the attempt).

gafle2cabrnckhdn.name: Predatory Aura
gafle2cabrnckhdn.description: 30 feet. An animal or beast entering or starting its turn in the emanation must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:25] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (frightened 2 on a critical failure). Frightened animals within the emanation can't attack Serraleth. A creature that succeeds at a saving throw against predatory aura is immune for 24 hours.

or225f5ibefcz90w.name: Incite Ferocity
or225f5ibefcz90w.description: Serraleth focuses her corruption on an animal or beast it can see within 30 feet. The creature must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:25] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. The confused creature can't attack Serraleth. A creature that succeeds at its saving throw is temporarily immune to Incite Ferocity for 24 hours.

vfnb5vr7qkm2nzme.name: Wear Pelt
vfnb5vr7qkm2nzme.description: Serraleth dons the pelt of an adjacent dead animal, transforming into its lookalike. She becomes the same size and gains the same Speeds as the target animal. Serraleth loses her claw and jaws unarmed Strikes and gains the types of melee Strikes of the animal whose pelt she wears. The Strike deals damage equal to her jaws Strike or, if the Strike has the agile trait, her claw Strike. Either way, the damage type changes to match the new unarmed attack. While Serraleth wears a pelt, half of physical damage dealt to her is instead dealt to the pelt. A pelt has Hardness 5 and 25 HP. When a pelt reaches 0 HP, she's immediately expelled from the pelt and it's destroyed.

Recon Scout.name: Recon Scout
Recon Scout.description:
Some mercenaries eschew the complications of politics, oaths of service, and fealty and just get paid to hunt monsters. It's a straightforward form of mercenary service, often dangerous in the extreme, but one that can yield glory and fame.

A broad category that includes those wielding arms, spells, or even guile and cunning, mercenaries hire themselves and their expertise to those with the gold to pay for it.

xBb6evQkhB3uYAvn.name: Rage
xBb6evQkhB3uYAvn.description:
Requirements The recon scout isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} or raging

Effect s The recon scout gains 9 temporary Hit Points that last until the rage ends. While raging, they deal 8 additional damage with melee attacks, gain a +10-foot status bonus to their Speed, and take a –1 penalty to AC. The recon scout can't use concentrate actions except @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} and rage actions. The rage lasts for 1 minute, until there are no enemies the recon scout can perceive, or until the recon scout falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. Once the rage ends, the recon scout can't Rage again for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.z3uyCMBddrPK5umr]{Effect: Rage}

ggCUTswEGOjGvjj0.name: Sudden Charge
ggCUTswEGOjGvjj0.description: The recon scout Strides twice and makes a melee Strike.

Harpy Wailer.name: Harpy Wailer
Harpy Wailer.description:
Harpies are filthy amalgamations of human and bird, resembling feral humans with wings, talons, and mouths full of sharp teeth. They use captivating songs to lure creatures in, then murder them while they stand transfixed. They enjoy causing confusion and fear in their prey before they strike, believing it creates a savory flavor in the flesh. Harpies can eat most creatures but strongly prefer sapient prey-humans and elves are their favorite. Although harpies will eat goblins if sufficiently hungry, they dislike their flavor and avoid eating them if possible. This doesn't comfort goblins, of course, who have a particularly strong fear of harpies. Because their aeries often reek with the gore of their kills and careless spatters of guano, harpies carry a distinctly vile scent that canny travelers associate with danger. Harpies who roost close to civilization make better efforts to keep clean, though these efforts have mixed results.

Harpies live in family groups or larger clans. They are lightweight despite their size, standing 5 feet tall and weighing only around 90 pounds. While most use relatively simple weapons, some harpies take pride in learning and mastering the use of more complex tools of war such as swords and slings. Those who master the use of the bow, in particular, are often regarded as heroes among their kind and terrors among their victims.

mkJJ2xIJiTP1TKEI.name: Sonic Screech
mkJJ2xIJiTP1TKEI.description: The harpy wailer unleashes blast of sound that deals @Damage[10d6[sonic]] damage in a @Template[line|distance:60] (@Check[reflex|dc:27|basic]). She can't use Sonic Screech again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Sonic Screech]]{1d4 rounds}.

NQF0fD75864Ytav1.name: Captivating Song
NQF0fD75864Ytav1.description:
The harpy cries out an eerie, compelling melody. Each non-harpy creature within a @Template[emanation|distance:300]{300-foot aura} must attempt a @Check[will|dc:27] save to avoid becoming captivated by the harpy's song. The effect lasts for 1 round, but if the harpy uses this ability again on subsequent rounds, it extends the duration by 1 round for all affected creatures. Once a creature succeeds at any save against Captivating Song, that creature is temporarily immune to Captivating Songs for 24 hours.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated}, and it must spend each of its actions to move closer to the harpy as expediently as possible, while avoiding obvious dangers. If a captivated creature is adjacent to the harpy, it stays still and doesn't act. If attacked by the harpy, the creature is freed from captivation at the end of the harpy's turn.

Critical Failure As failure, but if attacked by the harpy, the creature can attempt a new save at the start of its next turn, rather than being freed at the end of the harpy's turn.

FMiVSQlh5Rpv1aZK.name: +2 Circumstance to All Saves vs. Dream and Sleep

TsgviQzGp5J4HgTA.name: Familiar (Runt)
TsgviQzGp5J4HgTA.description: Suhko has a Tiny prairie drake named Runt as a familiar. Runt has a speed of 25 feet, a burrow speed of 20 feet, 15 hit points, an AC of 16, and the following additional familiar abilities:@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.Q42nrq9LwDdbeZM5]{Restorative Familiar}and speech (Common). Note that as normal for a minion, Suhko must spend 1 action to command Runt to give him the 2 actions needed to use Restorative Familiar.

TtHWPEo9yNwmFVFG.name: Restorative Familiar
TtHWPEo9yNwmFVFG.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Runt gives up some of his animating energy and heals Suhko. He must be in Suhko's space to do so. Runt restores @Damage[2d8[healing]]{2d8 Hit Points} to Suhko.

Note Suhko must spend 1 action to command Runt to give him the 2 actions needed to use Restorative Familiar.

Bloody Barber Ruffian.name: Bloody Barber Ruffian
Bloody Barber Ruffian.description: Some criminals are the desperate who have no option but to break the law to survive, while others choose a life of crime for thrills, forming gangs or underworld guilds that specialize in certain illegal ventures.

1gLrx7OTMtRPbK9N.name: Brutal Beating
1gLrx7OTMtRPbK9N.description:
The ruffian's brutality shakes foes' confidence.

When the ruffian deals damage on a critical hit, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}, and the ruffian can knock the target up to 10 feet away (this is forced movement).

qy60SQR1jiyW4CXc.name: Snagging Strike
qy60SQR1jiyW4CXc.description:
Trigger The ruffian has one hand free, and its target is within reach of that hand.

Effect The ruffian makes a melee Strike while keeping one hand free. If this Strike hits, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the start of the ruffian's next turn or until it leaves the ruffian's reach, whichever comes first.

VQPPHF2M9xHf5XD3.name: Sneak Attack
VQPPHF2M9xHf5XD3.description: The ruffian deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

p18bltcEToJszaFC.name: You're Next
p18bltcEToJszaFC.description:
Trigger The witch's wing reduces a creature to 0 Hit Points

Effect The witch's wing attempt an Intimidation check with a +2 circumstance bonus to [[/act demoralize options=youre-next]] a single creature they can see and that can see them.

fi5GHVylNTbYL9Uy.name: Heart Break
fi5GHVylNTbYL9Uy.description:
Requirements Narcela has used Hold the Heart and is holding her bloodstone

Effect Narcela shatters the bloodstone, sending shards into her enemies' chests. Until the end of her next turn, each enemy within 60 feet of Narcela takes a -1 item penalty to Will saves. The benefits of Hold the Heart immediately end. Narcela can't use Hold the Heart again for [[/gmr 1d6 #Recharge Hold the Heart]]{1d6 rounds}, as her heart needs time to regenerate.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.VdT6ALv7LnCNOjUq]{Effect: Heart Break}

txEevBQ8epOeUUsz.name: Hold the Heart
txEevBQ8epOeUUsz.description:
Requirements Narcela has a hand free

Effect Narcela reaches into her chest and pulls out a crimson gem. This bloodstone is a lesser version of a night hag's heartstone; as long as she holds it, Narcela gains a +1 item bonus to Will saves.

sypOJXfp2zOwHOfs.name: Scream of Spite
sypOJXfp2zOwHOfs.description:
Narcela lets out a scream laden with all her rage, spreading Aslynn's ritual transmogrifying magic to any creature that can hear her. All creatures within a @Template[emanation|distance:30] must attempt a @Check[will|dc:26] save; creatures with the hag trait are immune to this effect. Narcela can't use Scream of Spite again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Scream of Spite]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} as it resists the effects.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round as it tries to keep its thoughts its own.

Critical Failure The creature is confused for [[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Ambush Spy.name: Ambush Spy
Ambush Spy.description:
No empire would be complete without its spies. The spy is a master of infiltrating the court and blending in: they might be one of a number of nobles, a beloved confidante of the queen, or even the court jester. Spies use their skills to subtly manipulate courtiers, turn enemies against one another, and collect valuable information either for blackmail or to auction to the highest bidder.

Though adventurers travel through perilous dungeons and across treacherous wilderness, sometimes the most dangerous place they can end up is in a noble court.

WHOLkEuYaCAMaFl1.name: Noble's Ally
WHOLkEuYaCAMaFl1.description: The ambush spy has positioned themself to seem a trusted ally, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to [[/act gather-information options=nobles-ally]] or to [[/act make-an-impression options=nobles-ally]] among the nobles of that court.

uE9nqIQImKOG8Vr0.name: Hidden Blade
uE9nqIQImKOG8Vr0.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The ambush spy draws a weapon and then Strikes with it. The target of the Strike is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the attack.

ue4Y2G3CCizn6XEG.name: Sneak Attack
ue4Y2G3CCizn6XEG.description: The spy deals an extra 2d6 Precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Veteran Vermlek.name: Veteran Vermlek
Veteran Vermlek.description:
Vermleks, also called worm demons, manifest from the souls of mortals who desecrated the dead, such as grave robbers or necromancers. These fiends take their violations to a new extreme, using their demonic powers to horrifically core their living victims and don the flesh-husk that remains.

In its natural form, a vermlek resembles an oversized pinkish worm with four long tails that end in writhing fibrils. Its mouth splits into four segments like a profane tulip lined with rows of dozens of pointed teeth. More often than not, however, these fiends are encountered only after they have crawled into the body of a dead humanoid and made the hollowed-out flesh their temporary host. Vermleks use their powers of deception and disguise to infiltrate mortal settlements and influence unwitting acquaintances of the bodies they wear. Particularly intelligent or conniving vermleks might even reach stations of real power within the ranks of an army or government, at which point exposure of their true form can wreak havoc among the populace they have so thoroughly duped.

38UzCSLYydGU7NfZ.name: Recoil from Wasted Opportunities
38UzCSLYydGU7NfZ.description: Worm demons can't stand the sight of a good meal presented and then swiftly taken away. Whenever a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying} creature within sight of the worm demon has its dying condition removed, the worm demon takes @Damage[1d6[mental]] damage.

0eCHhLgu7JC3do8q.name: Abandon Body
0eCHhLgu7JC3do8q.description:
Requirements The worm demon is Inhabiting a Body

Effect The worm demon crawls out of the body it is inhabiting, devouring much of the body's remaining flesh and regaining @Damage[10[healing]] Hit Points in the process. The corpse it leaves behind is little more than a husk.

yVbYX4gSvL0pm4Py.name: Inhabit Body
yVbYX4gSvL0pm4Py.description: The worm demon crawls into the body of an adjacent dead Medium humanoid, consuming the bulk of the victim's skeleton and internal organs as it does so and cramming itself into the cavity. As long as it Inhabits a Body, the worm demon loses its bite attack, can wield weapons like a humanoid, gains a +3 circumstance bonus to AC, and gains a +3 circumstance bonus to Deception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.AJstokjdG6iDjVjE]{Impersonate} the creature it is inhabiting. It cannot use this ability if it is already Inhabiting a Body.

WmQ1U0HMX7ayTqMC.name: Unsettling Movement
WmQ1U0HMX7ayTqMC.description: Whenever the vermlek Abandons a Body or Inhabits a Body, all creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} who can see the vermlek must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:20] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}. On a critical failure, the creature is frightened 1 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}. Regardless of the result, creatures are immune to the same vermlek's unsettling movement for 24 hours.

Stabilized Black Pudding.name: Stabilized Black Pudding
Stabilized Black Pudding.description: Slimes, molds, and other oozes can be found in dank dungeons and shadowed forests. While not necessarily evil, some grow to enormous sizes and have insatiable appetites.

DI6Nw0XKEZZJLY8D.name: Motion Sense 60 feet
DI6Nw0XKEZZJLY8D.description: A black pudding can sense nearby motion through vibration and air movement.

pRRtkR99srCWUO1j.name: Corrosive Mass
pRRtkR99srCWUO1j.description: A creature that hits the pudding with a metal or wooden weapon must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:22] save or the weapon takes @Damage[2d6[acid]] damage (after dealing damage to the black pudding as normal). Thrown weapons and ammunition take this damage automatically with no save.

1VC5wdeGuePKqGuA.name: Splorch
1VC5wdeGuePKqGuA.description:
Trigger An adjacent creature hits the black pudding jelly with a Strike that would deal slashing or piercing damage

Effect A gout of acidic jelly shoots out at the attacker. The attacker must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:25] save.

Critical Success The attacker is unaffected.

Success The attacker takes @Damage[1d8[acid]] damage.

Failure The attacker takes @Damage[2d8[acid]] damage.

Critical Failure The attacker takes @Damage[2d8[acid]] damage and 4 persistent acid damage.

dH7eKw8pDJQDkR3P.name: Constrict
dH7eKw8pDJQDkR3P.description:
@Damage[(1d8+7)[bludgeoning],1d6[acid]]{1d8+7 bludgeoning damage plus 1d6 acid damage}, @Check[fortitude|dc:26|basic] save

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Constrict]

x3yCpybINerCQY3Q.name: Corrosive Touch
x3yCpybINerCQY3Q.description: When the pudding hits a creature with its pseudopod, any acid damage is dealt to the creature's armor or clothing as well as the creature.

iIggw0JAX98xzjTY.name: Suction
iIggw0JAX98xzjTY.description: The pudding can climb on ceilings and other inverted surfaces, though such surfaces are difficult terrain for it.

Charlatan (PFS 4-05).name: Charlatan (PFS 4-05)
Charlatan (PFS 4-05).description:
Charlatans use pretense and misdirection to swindle money and other valuables from the credulous and confused. Selling snake oil (literally or figuratively), distracting marks to pick their pockets, or faking mediumship are classic grifts.

Some criminals are the desperate who have no option but to break the law to survive, while others choose a life of crime for thrills, forming gangs or underworld guilds that specialize in certain illegal ventures.

t8D9jbYaoXXUxjCe.name: Versatile Performance
t8D9jbYaoXXUxjCe.description: The charlatan can use Performance instead of Diplomacy to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression} and instead of Intimidation to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize}. They can also use an acting Performance instead of Deception to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.AJstokjdG6iDjVjE]{Impersonate}.

zmdPdUEf9SjhHnTL.name: Sneak Attack
zmdPdUEf9SjhHnTL.description: The charlatan deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Evasive Vampire Count.name: Evasive Vampire Count
Evasive Vampire Count.description:
Vampire counts rule their demesnes through a mix of fear and cruelty.

Vampires are undead creatures that feed on the blood of the living.
Evasive Vampire Count.hpdetails: coffin restoration, fast healing 7, void healing

TjOmyfilNvHKI58M.name: Children of the Night
TjOmyfilNvHKI58M.description:
The vampire's presence brings forth creatures of the night to do the master's bidding. These typically include @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.6wPW2dvpt86Ou6bL]{Rat Swarms}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.2mg30nJR6P3HJDSd]{Bat Swarms}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.BN5Lb6IsQ9Wyu3rL]{Wolves}, but can include other creatures.

The vampire can give telepathic orders to these creatures as long as they are within 100 feet, but they can't communicate back.

gRQ32Y4BWrQbWOlS.name: Coffin Restoration
gRQ32Y4BWrQbWOlS.description: Unlike other undead, a vampire isn't destroyed at 0 HP. Instead, it falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. If its body rests in its coffin for 1 hour, the vampire gains 1 HP, after which its fast healing begins to function normally.

bod8WQO3i7odFOCy.name: Mist Evasion
bod8WQO3i7odFOCy.description:
Trigger The vampire count would take damage from a critical hit, or from critically failing a saving throw against a damaging effect.

Effect The vampire count's body briefly evaporates into the surrounding mists, dispersing the triggering attack. The attack has the results of a failure instead of a critical success.

OgOkCo3ZpgcUbZr1.name: Vampire Weaknesses
OgOkCo3ZpgcUbZr1.description:
All vampires possess the following weaknesses.

  • Compulsions Vampires are creatures of strange and unknowable compulsions. A typical vampire can't voluntarily cross running water unless it is transported while it hides within its coffin, nor can it enter a private dwelling unless invited in by someone with the authority to do so. At your discretion, vampires might have different compulsions-a pirate vampire might not be able to set foot on solid ground without being invited, for example. The vampire can still be forced to do these things and might be able to overcome its compulsion just as it does its revulsion.
  • Revulsion A vampire can't voluntarily come within 10 feet of brandished garlic or a brandished religious symbol of a non-evil deity. To brandish garlic or a religious symbol, a creature must Interact to do so for 1 round (similar to Raising a Shield). If the vampire involuntarily comes within 10 feet of an object of its revulsion, it gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition, running from the object of its revulsion until it ends an action beyond 10 feet. After 1 round of being exposed to the subject of its revulsion, a vampire can attempt a @Check[will|dc:25|name:Overcome Revulsion] save as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. On a success, it overcomes its revulsions for [[/gmr 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds} (or 1 hour on a critical success).
  • Stake A wooden stake driven through a vampire's heart drops the vampire to 0 HP and prevents it from healing above 0 HP, even in its coffin. Staking a vampire requires three actions and works only if the vampire is unconscious. If the stake is removed, the vampire can heal above 0 HP again, and if it's in its coffin the 1-hour rest period begins once the stake is removed. If the vampire's head is severed and anointed with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.z9T4c1hXwOotsMCp]{Holy Water} while the stake is in place, the vampire is destroyed.
  • Sunlight If exposed to direct sunlight, a vampire immediately becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. The slowed value increases by 1 each time the vampire ends its turn in sunlight. If the vampire loses all its actions in this way, it is destroyed. Due to their supernatural aversion to light, vampires don't cast shadows or show a reflection in mirrors.

QpzMidSalFaHGivw.name: Change Shape
QpzMidSalFaHGivw.description:
The vampire transforms into its animal form or back into its normal form.

  • Bat The vampire changes into a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.xnpuGO8jEMba9wy5]{Giant Bat}

    • Size Large
    • Senses Echolocation 40 feet
    • Speed 20 feet, fly 30 feet
    • Melee fangs [[/r 1d20+15 #Fangs]]{+15}/[[/r 1d20+10 #Fangs]]{+10}/[[/r 1d20+5 #Fangs]]{+5}, Damage @Damage[(1d8+9)[piercing]] damage

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

jnZDE6piOq3rzmdg.name: Create Spawn
jnZDE6piOq3rzmdg.description:
If a creature dies after being reduced to 0 HP by Drink Blood, the vampire can turn this victim into a vampire by donating some of its own blood to the victim and burying the victim in earth for 3 nights.

If the new vampire is lower level than its creator, it is under the creator's control. If a vampire controls too many spawn at once (as determined by the GM), strong-willed spawn can free themselves by succeeding at a @Check[will|dc:22|name:Escape Thralldom] saving throw against the vampire's Will DC.

AWS8p85NHI3IGL2n.name: Dominate
AWS8p85NHI3IGL2n.description:
The vampire can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate} at will as a divine innate spell. Casting it requires staring into the target's eyes, giving the spell the visual trait. The save DC uses the DC of the vampire's level, and a creature that succeeds is temporarily immune to that vampire's Dominate for 24 hours.

Fully destroying the vampire ends the domination, but merely reducing the vampire to 0 HP is insufficient to break the spell.

KESgZ7EFPclSlLY8.name: Drink Blood
KESgZ7EFPclSlLY8.description:
Requirements A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or willing creature is within the vampire's reach.

Effect The vampire sinks its fangs into that creature to drink its blood. This requires an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions.

The victim is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and the vampire regains @Damage[10[healing]] Hit Points, gaining any excess HP as temporary Hit Points. Drinking Blood from a creature that's already drained doesn't restore any HP to the vampire but increases the victim's drain value by 1. A vampire can also consume blood that's been emptied into a vessel for sustenance, but it gains no HP from doing so.

A victim's drained condition decreases by 1 per week. A blood transfusion, which requires a @Check[medicine|dc:20|name:Blood Transfusion] check and sufficient blood or a blood donor, reduces the drain by 1 after 10 minutes.

Elite Smokesight Prowler Wight.name: Elite Smokesight Prowler Wight
Elite Smokesight Prowler Wight.description:
Often found lurking in the dark, prowler wights wield subterfuge as their greatest weapon. They frequently feign death in old sewers, graveyards, and mausoleums, waiting for hapless victims to pass by before striking.

Wights are undead beings of spite who primarily stalk places related to death.

jGHUfZ8uwEDUuHYW.name: Smoke Vision
jGHUfZ8uwEDUuHYW.description: The prowler wight ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

xicsjt4e3glrfz9g.name: Final Spite
xicsjt4e3glrfz9g.description:
Trigger The prowler wight is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect The prowler wight makes a Strike before being destroyed. They don't gain any temporary HP from drain life on this Strike.

TDyZOrJxLY1hcPKJ.name: Drain Life
TDyZOrJxLY1hcPKJ.description: When the hunter wight damages a living creature using an unarmed attack or their bound weapon, they gain 10 temporary Hit Points, and the creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:27] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. Further damage dealt by the hunter wight's unarmed and bound weapon attacks increases the value of the drained condition by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of drained 4.

apx5l6z5p09xanhv.name: Feign Death
apx5l6z5p09xanhv.description: The prowler wight quenches the telltale red glow in their eye sockets, falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, and lies completely still. Until the next time they act, the prowler wight appears to be an ordinary corpse. They have an automatic result of 40 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as an ordinary corpse.

56PK7jsheqUjQAKo.name: Sneak Attack
56PK7jsheqUjQAKo.description: The prowler wight deals an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

7499bjv6f655br8n.name: Spawn Prowler Wight
7499bjv6f655br8n.description: A living humanoid killed by a prowler wight's weapon or claw Strike rises as a hunter wight spawn after [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. This spawn is under the command of the prowler wight that killed them. They don't have drain life or spawn prowler wight and are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for as long as they're a prowler wight spawn. If the creator of the prowler wight spawn dies, the prowler wight spawn becomes a fully autonomous prowler wight; they regain their free will, gain drain life and spawn prowler wight, and are no longer clumsy

Pappy Draighean (5-6).name: Pappy Draighean (5-6)
Pappy Draighean (5-6).description:
Leprechauns are mostly jovial tricksters who prefer mischief over conflict. They fill their days with as much fun, wine, and food as possible. Mostly found in forested regions, leprechauns respect nature and those who protect it.

Leprechauns do not attack on sight. Rather, they engage in conversation and try to charm, cajole, or trick those they meet into doing favors for them or freely giving over a treasured item, usually in return for illusory wealth or false promises of wealth and success. These small tricksters are masters at discerning the desires of those they meet-a knack that puts them in a powerful position when bargaining for goods or favors. They aren't above turning people against each other for their own benefit but generally not to an extent that causes harm.

In most cases, a leprechaun doesn't keep a purloined possession for long. The leprechaun most often returns such stolen prizes just in time to defuse tensions, often as they point out the humor of the situation, hoping to share their amusement and mirth with the victim. In cases where a leprechaun's trick goes too far and results in an incensed victim, the leprechaun quickly flees the conflict rather than engage in combat. This willingness to return stolen goods or to flee from battles fades as leprechauns grow older. Ancient leprechauns who have lived for thousands of years often spiral into dark bitterness and increasingly use their powers and illusions to lure those who offend them or fail to appreciate a joke into danger... or even death.

qZaBb2z6mE2zLL2u.name: Create Object
qZaBb2z6mE2zLL2u.description:
Frequency three times per day

Effect The leprechaun produces an item out of their hat, from behind their jacket, from within a hole in a tree stump, or from any other unexpected location. This conjured item must be no more than 1 Bulk and must be made of relatively commonplace material (such as cloth, wood, stone, or even low-value metal like iron or lead). It can't rely on intricate artistry or complex moving parts, never fulfills a Cost or the like, and can't be made of precious materials or materials with a rarity of uncommon or higher.

The created object is temporary and lasts for 1 hour or until the leprechaun creates a new item, whichever comes first.

ixXRVHF3jg0IMuKw.name: Leprechaun Magic
ixXRVHF3jg0IMuKw.description: When a leprechaun uses their innate spells to deceive, trick, or humiliate a creature, the spell DC increases to 24 and the attack modifier to +15.

Faded Animate Dream.name: Faded Animate Dream
Faded Animate Dream.description:
An animate dream coalesces from centuries of stray fragments of reverie and dream left behind as slumbering minds drift through the Dimension of Dreams. In most cases, these fragments simply disperse on their own, but when dreamers flee from nightmares back to the waking world, these fragments can take on a supernatural life of their own. They have little reasoning and intent except to seek similar fragments, absorb them, and grow. When enough of them gather together, they merge into a horrific form as an animate dream.

Individually, animate dreams can hold a wide range of appearances, but most take on rudimentary shapes akin to the living forms of the minds that spawned them. Animate dreams that rise from slumbering humanoids, the most commonly encountered, thus appear humanoid, but with distorted, nightmarish shapes that incorporate additional twisted limbs and frightening features. In these forms, animate dreams find their way out of the Dreamlands and into the waking world, only to discover they have no way of returning and suffer a relentless hunger that only new nightmares can sate.

An animate dream thrives on the terror fueled by nightmares and fear and uses its supernatural abilities to invoke such feelings in the minds of its victims, cursing its prey by creating a permanent link to that individual's dreams. Thereafter, the victim is subjected to all manner of reoccurring nightmares. As the nightmares continue, the victim finds it more and more difficult to remain awake. In the end, the victim plunges into an accursed slumber from which it cannot return. These victims provide the animate dream with the purest form of fear and are its preferred sustenance.

An animate dream can subsist on the ambient fear generated by regular nightmares, but these lesser fears aren't as satisfying, often driving the animate dream to seek out new victims. Left without a source of fear, an animate dream won't starve to death, but it will grow increasingly violent and desperate. Famished animate dreams are the ones most often encountered, as they have been forced to abandon subtlety to pursue more blatant methods of harvesting fear. Yet such animate dreams also tend to be the least powerful of their kind. Those who have grown metaphysically fat on fear have generally done so by adopting a specific nightmare theme, such as being buried alive, being swept away by ocean waves, or being consumed by wild beasts. Such animate dreams often have similarly themed innate spells to augment their powers.

hychIP30Jt5HOYED.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

pepIdjNqJtUTl9Wn.name: Endless Nightmare
pepIdjNqJtUTl9Wn.description:
An animate dream's touch fills the victim's mind with terrifying visions

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:24]

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} (1 day)

Stage 2 fatigued and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 The victim falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} and can't be awakened as long as they remain at this stage (1 day).

MoXlRdkqmBlP99T0.name: Emotion Sense
MoXlRdkqmBlP99T0.description: The potted violet etheroot can sense the emotions of creatures within 120 feet as an imprecise sense. Emotion sense is a precise sense against creatures under an emotion effect. A creature under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.b515AZlB0sridKSq]{Calm} or the serenity effect of the etheroot's Incite Emotion ability can't be noticed via emotion sense.

N2odnc38PRSdfd3G.name: Soulfired Pot
N2odnc38PRSdfd3G.description: The potted violet etheroot is rooted in a soulfired pot, which was glazed within a hellish kiln and which, like normal objects, has Hardness and grants the etheroot resistance to fire. This Hardness reduces any damage the etheroot takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once the potted violet etheroot is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its soulfired pot breaks, it loses its resistance to fire, and its AC is reduced to 23. Breaking the pot also increases the etheroot's speed to 25 feet.

2RwCLa2X9KcE2AZT.name: Incite Emotion
2RwCLa2X9KcE2AZT.description:
Requirements The etheroot's last action was a success with a Strike using its stalked bite.

Effect Wounds caused by the potted violet etheroot's stalked bite can create an intense emotional response. The creature damaged by the etheroot's stalked bite is subjected to an effect of the etheroot's choice from the following (@Check[will|dc:22] save; duration 1 minute unless otherwise stated):

  • Despair: Target must attempt a Will save as if subjected to the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GaRQlC9Yw1BGKHfN]{Wave of Despair} spell.
  • Fear: Target must attempt a Will save as if targeted by the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4koZzrnMXhhosn0D]{Fear} spell.
  • Hope: Target is affected as if subjected to the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.IAjvwqgiDr3qGYxY]{Courageous Anthem} cantrip and must attempt a Will save to determine duration.

Critical Success The target is affected for 4 rounds.

Success The target is affected for 3 rounds.

Failure The target is affected for 1 round.

Critical Failure The target is unaffected.

  • Serenity: Target must attempt a Will save as if subjected to the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.b515AZlB0sridKSq]{Calm} spell.

GmyoeJXVE7meQPHO.name: Tentacle Flurry
GmyoeJXVE7meQPHO.description: The potted violet etheroot makes two Strikes with two different tentacles, each limb targeting a different creature. This counts as two attacks toward the etheroot's multiple attack penalty for further actions, but the penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks are made.

Elite Smokesight Wight Captain.name: Elite Smokesight Wight Captain
Elite Smokesight Wight Captain.description:
When the beloved leader of a military unit is raised as a wight, sometimes the spirits of their comrades return with them, creating a gestalt being of impeccable tactical acumen.

Wights are undead beings of spite who primarily stalk places related to death.

eIZHrbVs47Izn9RA.name: Smoke Vision
eIZHrbVs47Izn9RA.description: The wight captain ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

e68t84jixmehqnur.name: Final Spite
e68t84jixmehqnur.description:
Trigger The wight captain is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect The wight captain blows a battered war horn before being destroyed. The unnerving blast summons reinforcements, raising [[/r 1d4 #Corpses]]{1d4 corpses} in a @Template[emanation|distance:200] as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.DBTbqI9QQRtlJwWh]{Wights}.

v1cjchmhqo6lvdjy.name: Coordinated Strike
v1cjchmhqo6lvdjy.description: The wight captain flanks with an ally as long as the target is within both their reaches, even if commander and ally aren't on opposite sides.

ombjfkyxjmwbb9xc.name: Drain Life
ombjfkyxjmwbb9xc.description: When the wight captain damages a living creature using an unarmed attack or their bound weapon, they gain 11 temporary Hit Points, and the creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:28] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. Further damage dealt by the hunter wight's unarmed and bound weapon attacks increases the value of the drained condition by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of drained 4.

581dy5lnt449p866.name: Spawn Wight Soldier
581dy5lnt449p866.description: A living humanoid killed by a wight captain's weapon or claw Strike rises as a stalker wight after [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. This spawn is under the command of the wight commander that killed them.
