ewnVfX7kqqfaToZR.description: A creature that's critically hit by an enormous rat must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:20] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Yl48xTdMh3aeQYL2]{Wounded 1} as the creature's bones or cartilage are crushed by the rat's jaws.

Fetid Familiar.name: Fetid Familiar
Fetid Familiar.description:
With their distinctive black bodies and white stripes or spots, skunks are instantly recognizable to most creatures. Those who catch a full blast of musk rarely decide to trouble a skunk again, as the revolting stench can linger for hours or even days. Removing the odor is difficult, typically requiring the aid of alchemy or magic.

These omnivores are most active at twilight, feeding on everything from berries to grubs and insects. Some farmers even encourage the animals to live near their farms to keep destructive pest populations low.

HTp6N4B1ohShQdxQ.name: Evil Musk
HTp6N4B1ohShQdxQ.description:
The fetid familiar propels a stream of acrid musk in a @Template[line|distance:10]. Each creature in the line must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:15] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} until the musk is removed or neutralized, requiring 10 minutes of thorough scrubbing with soap.

YiAJAUnLYTzQ6ys0.name: Unnerving Prowess
YiAJAUnLYTzQ6ys0.description:
Trigger Dura critically succeeds at a Strike or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} with her Aldori dueling sword.

Effect Dura attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} the target of her Strike or Disarm. This Demoralize attempt does not have the auditory trait, nor does Dura take a penalty to the check if the target doesn't understand her language.

Ambush Raider.name: Ambush Raider
Ambush Raider.description:
Great treasure awaits those willing to explore the hazardous depths of the world's ancient tombs and forgotten dungeons. Some tomb raiders seek riches of bygone eras; others recover pieces of history thought lost to the sands of time.

The world is a wide, open place fraught with peril and adventure. Explorers use their knowledge of nature and survival skills to see every corner of the land.

taX3Q0r1h37NNYFO.name: Hazard Spotter
taX3Q0r1h37NNYFO.description: The tomb raider automatically attempts a secret Perception check to notice a hazard when they are within 10 feet of the hazard.

XPYr9hMESgVNjbVp.name: Trick Attack
XPYr9hMESgVNjbVp.description: The tomb raider musters their guile to attempt a clever attack that catches their foe unprepared. The tomb raider chooses one of their weapons. The next attack with that weapon deals an extra 2d6 precision damage. In addition, the tomb raider can Interact to draw the weapon (or to reload it if they choose the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.XyA6PKV46aNlLXOd]{Hand Crossbow}).

Smokesight Prowler Wight.name: Smokesight Prowler Wight
Smokesight Prowler Wight.description:
Often found lurking in the dark, prowler wights wield subterfuge as their greatest weapon. They frequently feign death in old sewers, graveyards, and mausoleums, waiting for hapless victims to pass by before striking.

Wights are undead beings of spite who primarily stalk places related to death.

jGHUfZ8uwEDUuHYW.name: Smoke Vision
jGHUfZ8uwEDUuHYW.description: The prowler wight ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

xicsjt4e3glrfz9g.name: Final Spite
xicsjt4e3glrfz9g.description:
Trigger The prowler wight is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect The prowler wight makes a Strike before being destroyed. They don't gain any temporary HP from drain life on this Strike.

TDyZOrJxLY1hcPKJ.name: Drain Life
TDyZOrJxLY1hcPKJ.description: When the hunter wight damages a living creature using an unarmed attack or their bound weapon, they gain 9 temporary Hit Points, and the creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:25] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. Further damage dealt by the hunter wight's unarmed and bound weapon attacks increases the value of the drained condition by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of drained 4.

apx5l6z5p09xanhv.name: Feign Death
apx5l6z5p09xanhv.description: The prowler wight quenches the telltale red glow in their eye sockets, falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, and lies completely still. Until the next time they act, the prowler wight appears to be an ordinary corpse. They have an automatic result of 38 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as an ordinary corpse.

56PK7jsheqUjQAKo.name: Sneak Attack
56PK7jsheqUjQAKo.description: The prowler wight deals an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

7499bjv6f655br8n.name: Spawn Prowler Wight
7499bjv6f655br8n.description: A living humanoid killed by a prowler wight's weapon or claw Strike rises as a hunter wight spawn after [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. This spawn is under the command of the prowler wight that killed them. They don't have drain life or spawn prowler wight and are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for as long as they're a prowler wight spawn. If the creator of the prowler wight spawn dies, the prowler wight spawn becomes a fully autonomous prowler wight; they regain their free will, gain drain life and spawn prowler wight, and are no longer clumsy

rm5sOGU46Lbwed4O.name: Aldori Parry
rm5sOGU46Lbwed4O.description: Thisnabel gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of their next turn.

sqsHfPzCBU6rGYz1.name: Sneak Attack
sqsHfPzCBU6rGYz1.description: Thisnabel deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Elven Torchbearer.name: Elven Torchbearer
Elven Torchbearer.description:
Torchbearers carry a light sources for seasoned explorers and serve as apprentices.

The world is a wide, open place fraught with peril and adventure. Explorers use their knowledge of nature and survival skills to see every corner of the land.

Pa0KJtbEU8gMH1Qh.name: Torch Combatant
Pa0KJtbEU8gMH1Qh.description: A torchbearer is adept at attacking with torches and deals @Damage[1[persistent,fire]] damage when they critically hit with a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.8Jdw4yAzWYylGePS]{Torch}.

ffdirXFSKr2vqlqP.name: +1 Status to All Saves Vs. Mental Effects

sruAZbRITPlv3UJ8.name: Shattered Mirror
sruAZbRITPlv3UJ8.description: When an Aslynn's eye dies, their body explodes in a @Template[burst|distance:20] of jagged glass shards that deal @Damage[5d6[slashing]] damage to each creature in the area (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic] save).

8GBQQQxNAWNNzaGQ.name: Dream Eating
8GBQQQxNAWNNzaGQ.description:
An Aslynn's eye can consume the subconscious dreams of a creature within 30 feet; the creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:21] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and is temporarily immune to the Aslynn's eye's dream eating for 1 day.

Success Target takes @Damage[1d6[mental]] damage and Aslynn's eye gains temporary Hit Points equal to half the mental damage the target takes. If the target's Hit Points were lower than the damage dealt, the Aslynn's eye gains temporary Hit Points equal to their remaining Hit Points instead.

Failure As success, but target takes @Damage[2d6[mental]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round.

Critical Failure As success, but target takes @Damage[4d6[mental]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 minute.

DIQp8sq3PKsnRMuE.name: Mirror Travel
DIQp8sq3PKsnRMuE.description: An Aslynn's eye can crawl into any mirror within their reach as if it were a door or window, instantly transporting them as well as any items they're wearing and holding to another mirror within 500 feet. The Aslynn's eye can remain within the mirror indefinitely or, provided they're using their Mirrored Transformation ability, they may choose to exit a mirror as part of any action they take with the Move trait. An Aslynn's eye can't exit a mirror unless they're using their Mirrored Transformation ability to take a specific creature's form. An Aslynn's eye can't exit a mirror that has the broken condition.

3D6tfBRQsCUQMSMX.name: Mirrored Transformation
3D6tfBRQsCUQMSMX.description: An Aslynn's eye takes the appearance of a mirrored version of any Large or smaller creature who they have seen and whose appearance they remember. While those who are not familiar with the subject of their mimicry may be fooled by the disguise, those who know the subject well automatically notice the mirroring effect. This ability doesn't change the Speed of the Aslynn's eye or their attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes but might change the damage type their Strikes deal.

iSXcIEG9tvvik1O2.name: Psychic Assault
iSXcIEG9tvvik1O2.description: The Aslynn's eye imbues their attacks with a psychic assault, infusing the mind of the creature struck with hideous nightmare visions and hallucinations. A creature damaged by the Aslynn's eye's fist must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:21] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round. On a critical failure, the target is dazzled for [[/gmr 1d4 #Rounds]] rounds and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Elite Smokesight Hunter Wight.name: Elite Smokesight Hunter Wight
Elite Smokesight Hunter Wight.description:
Dangers deep in the wilderness claim the life some lone scout or hunter. When they arise as wights, they renew their hunt with equal vigor, but all the living are now their prey. Hunter wights prefer to seek strategic ground, frequently taking residence atop hills or within abandoned watchtowers and keeps.

Wights are undead beings of spite who primarily stalk places related to death.

TOApogIgln0yhGda.name: Smoke Vision
TOApogIgln0yhGda.description: The hunter wight ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

479508pjo4uznsty.name: Final Snare
479508pjo4uznsty.description:
Trigger The hunter wight is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect The hunter wight has rigged their own body with a snare, which they trigger before being destroyed. Slivers of bone launch at an adjacent creature, dealing @Damage[(4d8+4)[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:27|basic]).

3gvb9wq37oq21be3.name: Drain Life
3gvb9wq37oq21be3.description: When the hunter wight damages a living creature using an unarmed attack or their bound weapon, they gain 8 temporary Hit Points, and the creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:24] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. Further damage dealt by the hunter wight's unarmed and bound weapon attacks increases the value of the drained condition by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of drained 4.

4z31tccif8f7qaq7.name: Spawn Hunter Wight
4z31tccif8f7qaq7.description: A living humanoid killed by a hunter wight's weapon or claw Strike rises as a hunter wight spawn after [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. This spawn is under the command of the hunter wight that killed them. They don't have drain life or spawn hunter wight and are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for as long as they're a hunter wight spawn. If the creator of the hunter wight spawn dies, the hunter wight spawn becomes a fully autonomous hunter wight; they regain their free will, gain drain life and spawn hunter wight, and are no longer clumsy

ag4Kb9quogMFOA0m.name: +2 Circumstance to All Saves vs. Dream and Sleep

TsgviQzGp5J4HgTA.name: Familiar (Runt)
TsgviQzGp5J4HgTA.description: Suhko has a Tiny prairie drake named Runt as a familiar. Runt has a speed of 25 feet, a burrow speed of 20 feet, 5 hit points, an AC of 16, and the following additional familiar abilities: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.Q42nrq9LwDdbeZM5]{Restorative Familiar} and speech (Common). Note that as normal for a minion, Suhko must spend 1 action to command Runt to give him the 2 actions needed to use Restorative Familiar.

TtHWPEo9yNwmFVFG.name: Restorative Familiar
TtHWPEo9yNwmFVFG.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Runt gives up some of his animating energy and heals Suhko. He must be in Suhko's space to do so. Runt restores @Damage[1d8[healing]]{1d8 Hit Points} to Suhko.

Note Suhko must spend 1 action to command Runt to give him the 2 actions needed to use Restorative Familiar.

Bugbear Creeper.name: Bugbear Creeper
Bugbear Creeper.description:
The more common bugbear thug specializes in the art of lurking in the shadows.

These stealthy and cruel goblinoid creatures delight in spreading fear and tormenting their victims. Bugbears are the monsters lurking in the closet and hiding under the bed. Preying on remote farmsteads, bugbears reveal their presence with thumps in the night or creaks of boards to build lurking dread and arouse suspicion and fear.

3oT1SbjJML9Ta48B.name: Creep
3oT1SbjJML9Ta48B.description:
Trigger A creature within 15 feet gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition or its frightened value increases

Effect The bugbear creeper Hides, Sneaks, or Steps.

Deimostride (7-8).name: Deimostride (7-8)
Deimostride (7-8).description: Nightmares are flaming equine harbingers of death.

v20CVlD558D960nv.name: (Trait) Experiment
v20CVlD558D960nv.description: This creature has the experiment trait. There is no description of what this trait is.

2YTJc5tMZha1HD75.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Death Effects, Disease, and Poison

nbWXPfh7WyVCERN9.name: Smoke
nbWXPfh7WyVCERN9.description: 15 feet. Deimostride continually exhales black smoke that creates @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealment} in an aura around him. Deimostride and his riders can see through this smoke. A creature that begins its turn in the area becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} (@Check[fortitude|dc:23] negates) and is then temporarily immune sickness from the smoke for 1 minute. Deimostride, his rider, any creature currently holding its breath (or that does not need to breathe), and any creature immune to poison are immune to the aura's sickened effect but not the concealment.

Huqh2NJEkx1xBpoO.name: Flaming Gallop
Huqh2NJEkx1xBpoO.description: Deimostride Strides or Flies up to triple its Speed. Its hooves burst with intense flame, dealing @Damage[(3d6+2)[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic] save) once to each creature other than his rider that he moves adjacent to during its gallop.

Bloody Barber Thief.name: Bloody Barber Thief
Bloody Barber Thief.description:
Burglars specialize in breaking and entering to rob homes and businesses. These criminals focus on gaining access to secure buildings and bypassing traps and other security measures while remaining undetected all the while.

Some criminals are the desperate who have no option but to break the law to survive, while others choose a life of crime for thrills, forming gangs or underworld guilds that specialize in certain illegal ventures.

Y4ZPmVCbnUAexfGS.name: +1 Circumstance to All Saves vs. Traps

sDwLsrlMceRxlzIo.name: Deny Advantage
sDwLsrlMceRxlzIo.description: The thief isn't off-guard to creatures of 5th level or lower that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected}, flanking, or using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.w6rMqmGzhUahdnA7]{Surprise Attack}.

zS04tb23VRw9X9kX.name: Nimble Dodge
zS04tb23VRw9X9kX.description:
Trigger The thief is targeted with a melee or ranged attack by an attacker it can see.

Effect The thief gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

OzTxpPbEz9oZ7Oxz.name: Mobility
OzTxpPbEz9oZ7Oxz.description: When the thief Strides half their speed or less, that movement does not trigger reactions.

J2jz17JAQtHVQs5I.name: Sneak Attack
J2jz17JAQtHVQs5I.description: The thief deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Laex9xerP0tAva7M.name: Surprise Attack
Laex9xerP0tAva7M.description: On the first round of combat, if the thief rolls Deception or Stealth for initiative, creatures that haven't acted are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to them.

ffdirXFSKr2vqlqP.name: +1 Status to All Saves Vs. Mental Effects

sruAZbRITPlv3UJ8.name: Shattered Mirror
sruAZbRITPlv3UJ8.description: When an Aslynn's eye dies, their body explodes in a @Template[burst|distance:20] of jagged glass shards that deal @Damage[7d6[slashing]] damage to each creature in the area (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic] save).

8GBQQQxNAWNNzaGQ.name: Dream Eating
8GBQQQxNAWNNzaGQ.description:
An Aslynn's sharper eye can consume the subconscious dreams of a creature within 30 feet; the creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:24] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and is temporarily immune to the Aslynn's sharper eye's dream eating for 1 day.

Success Target takes @Damage[(1d6+3)[mental]] damage and Aslynn's sharper eye gains temporary Hit Points equal to half the mental damage the target takes. If the target's Hit Points were lower than the damage dealt, the Aslynn's sharper eye gains temporary Hit Points equal to their remaining Hit Points instead.

Failure As success, but target takes @Damage[3d6[mental]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round.

Critical Failure As success, but target takes @Damage[6d6[mental]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 minute.

DIQp8sq3PKsnRMuE.name: Mirror Travel
DIQp8sq3PKsnRMuE.description: An Aslynn's sharper eye can crawl into any mirror within their reach as if it were a door or window, instantly transporting them as well as any items they're wearing and holding to another mirror within 500 feet. The Aslynn's sharper eye can remain within the mirror indefinitely or, provided they're using their Mirrored Transformation ability, they may choose to exit a mirror as part of any action they take with the Move trait. An Aslynn's sharper eye can't exit a mirror unless they're using their Mirrored Transformation ability to take a specific creature's form. An Aslynn's sharper eye can't exit a mirror that has the broken condition.

3D6tfBRQsCUQMSMX.name: Mirrored Transformation
3D6tfBRQsCUQMSMX.description: An Aslynn's sharper eye takes the appearance of a mirrored version of any Large or smaller creature who they have seen and whose appearance they remember. While those who are not familiar with the subject of their mimicry may be fooled by the disguise, those who know the subject well automatically notice the mirroring effect. This ability doesn't change the Speed of the Aslynn's sharper eye or their attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes but might change the damage type their Strikes deal.

iSXcIEG9tvvik1O2.name: Psychic Assault
iSXcIEG9tvvik1O2.description: The Aslynn's sharper eye imbues their attacks with a psychic assault, infusing the mind of the creature struck with hideous nightmare visions and hallucinations. A creature damaged by the Aslynn's sharper eye's fist must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:24] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round. On a critical failure, the target is dazzled for [[/gmr 1d4 #Rounds]] rounds and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Runt (1-2).name: Runt (1-2)
Runt (1-2).description:
These squat, mud-brown drakes resemble scaly pit bulls with blunt, toothy snouts. The desert drake is the prairie drake's closest known relative, as both share a strong affinity for earth, can burrow through soil, and hack up balls of dirt that they aim at enemies. But whereas a desert drake is sleek and nimble, flying through lightning storms and siroccos with ease, the prairie drake has all the grace of a chicken, barely able to flutter clumsily up a low hill or over a boulder. Owing to their largely vestigial wings, it's no wonder prairie drakes prefer burrowing over soaring.

The average prairie drake has a temperament similar to that of a wicked child who delights in tormenting others. They ambush tiny animals from underground and play with their food thoroughly before eating. To assert their supremacy over other scrubland predators, prairie drakes knock down their rivals and attack them mercilessly. They often make grisly displays from the corpses of their foes to intimidate other would-be competitors.

Prairie drakes build and live in burrow mounds just beneath the surface of their environs. They make shallow tunnels in search of large insects, rodents, and ground snakes. Prairie drakes' presence helps to turn the topsoil and encourage new plant growth, supporting other animal life and making them a keystone species for the environment. Even their breath weapon leaves behind rich "drake soil," coveted by farmers and gardeners for the potent effects it has on plants. Being seen as "useful" or "beneficial" annoys most prairie drakes, who believe such a reputation makes them look weak and conflicts with their "apex predator" mystique. After they've gotten too much positive attention, a prairie drake is apt to murder a farm animal or destroy croplands only to prove that they're far from harmless.

Dig-Widget (PFS 4-07).name: Dig-Widget (PFS 4-07)
Dig-Widget (PFS 4-07).description:
Thieves covet dig-widgets, specialized constructs built for infiltration. Each dig-widget contains numerous simple tools, including a set of mechanical devices that function as thieves' tools, two arms with drills, and two arms with corkscrews for attaching to and climbing surfaces. Once activated, these devices propel themselves forward. Though they have the full faculties typical of a construct, they usually follow a simple routine: avoid notice, pick any lock barring the path, dig past obstacles, and attack if caught. They're rarely left unattended, as a thief needs to be nearby to follow after-both to steal goods and to stop the dig-widget from engaging in further larceny once it's achieved its goal.

The source of a dig-widget's power is as much mechanical as it is magical. The gears and springs that provide a dig-widget mobility are an improvement over more primitive true clockwork creations (whose functions require constant winding to remain mobile), but at the cost of security, for a dig-widget's moving parts can be dismantled quickly by thieves and others with the proper training.

ZMxrbMShYOtO3gEG.name: Infiltration Tools
ZMxrbMShYOtO3gEG.description: A dig-widget's face consists of a set of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.6nrCxNQFycUVFOV2]{Infiltrator Thieves' Tools}. They can be salvaged from a destroyed dig-widget with a successful @Check[crafting|dc:20|name:Salvage Infiltration Tools] check. On a failed check, the tools are destroyed.

nYQgnHNVs60rcvUn.name: Mechanical Vulnerability
nYQgnHNVs60rcvUn.description: Flaw in the construction of dig-widgets leave them vulnerable to disassembly. An adjacent creature with expert proficiency in Thievery can spend two actions to attempt a @Check[thievery|dc:20] check to Disable a Device to damage a dig-widget. If the check succeeds, the dig-widget takes [[/r 20]]{20 damage}.

mGkbLuXtisEvFNNs.name: Fastening Leap
mGkbLuXtisEvFNNs.description: The dig-widget Leaps up 20 feet onto a creature or object and attempts a corkscrew Strike against it. If the Strike damages the target, the dig-widget attaches to the target (typically to the back of a creature). This is similar to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.Tkd8sH4pwFIPzqTr]{Grabbing} the creature, but the dig-widget moves with that creature rather than holding it in place. While attached, the dig-widget can't use its corkscrew. The dig-widget can be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shoved} off, or it can detach itself with an Interact action.

MH7wNM2dBDOtmzVO.name: Sneak Attack
MH7wNM2dBDOtmzVO.description: A dig-widget's Strikes deal an additional 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Weak Cunning Vampire Spawn.name: Weak Cunning Vampire Spawn
Weak Cunning Vampire Spawn.description:
Vampires use their spawn for infiltration and reconnaissance.

Vampires are undead creatures that feed on the blood of the living.
Weak Cunning Vampire Spawn.hpdetails: coffin restoration, fast healing 5, void healing

RaYfxxlT031lUgCP.name: Coffin Restoration
RaYfxxlT031lUgCP.description: Unlike other undead, a vampire isn't destroyed at 0 HP. Instead, it falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. If its body rests in its coffin for 1 hour, the vampire gains 1 HP, after which its fast healing begins to function normally.

mK3REH0Jcz0NP7Bh.name: Vampire Weaknesses
mK3REH0Jcz0NP7Bh.description:
All vampires possess the following weaknesses.

  • Compulsions Vampires are creatures of strange and unknowable compulsions. A typical vampire can't voluntarily cross running water unless it is transported while it hides within its coffin, nor can it enter a private dwelling unless invited in by someone with the authority to do so. At your discretion, vampires might have different compulsions-a pirate vampire might not be able to set foot on solid ground without being invited, for example. The vampire can still be forced to do these things and might be able to overcome its compulsion just as it does its revulsion.
  • Revulsion A vampire can't voluntarily come within 10 feet of brandished garlic or a brandished religious symbol of a non-evil deity. To brandish garlic or a religious symbol, a creature must Interact to do so for 1 round (similar to Raising a Shield). If the vampire involuntarily comes within 10 feet of an object of its revulsion, it gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition, running from the object of its revulsion until it ends an action beyond 10 feet. After 1 round of being exposed to the subject of its revulsion, a vampire can attempt a @Check[will|dc:25|name:Overcome Revulsion] save as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. On a success, it overcomes its revulsions for [[/gmr 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds} (or 1 hour on a critical success).
  • Stake A wooden stake driven through a vampire's heart drops the vampire to 0 HP and prevents it from healing above 0 HP, even in its coffin. Staking a vampire requires three actions and works only if the vampire is unconscious. If the stake is removed, the vampire can heal above 0 HP again, and if it's in its coffin the 1-hour rest period begins once the stake is removed. If the vampire's head is severed and anointed with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.z9T4c1hXwOotsMCp]{Holy Water} while the stake is in place, the vampire is destroyed.
  • Sunlight If exposed to direct sunlight, a vampire immediately becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. The slowed value increases by 1 each time the vampire ends its turn in sunlight. If the vampire loses all its actions in this way, it is destroyed. Due to their supernatural aversion to light, vampires don't cast shadows or show a reflection in mirrors.

hn5GBufYeA5C1oOg.name: Drink Blood
hn5GBufYeA5C1oOg.description:
Requirements A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or willing creature is within the vampire's reach.

Effect The vampire sinks its fangs into that creature to drink its blood. This requires an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions.

The victim is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and the vampire regains @Damage[5[healing]] Hit Points, gaining any excess HP as temporary Hit Points. Drinking Blood from a creature that's already drained doesn't restore any HP to the vampire but increases the victim's drain value by 1. A vampire can also consume blood that's been emptied into a vessel for sustenance, but it gains no HP from doing so.

A victim's drained condition decreases by 1 per week. A blood transfusion, which requires a @Check[medicine|dc:20|name:Blood Transfusion] check and sufficient blood or a blood donor, reduces the drain by 1 after 10 minutes.

T0aFMtDJ5aZm7aQG.name: Sneak Attack
T0aFMtDJ5aZm7aQG.description: The vampire spawn deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Transformed Bremix (7-8).name: Transformed Bremix (7-8)
Transformed Bremix (7-8).description:
Skelms crave power, and the palace skelms who stalk the halls where such power concentrates are among the most dangerous of their kind. They assume titles that allow them maximum freedom to punish or hurt others with minimal oversight: any vindictive guard captain, tyrannical viceroy, or needlessly cruel magistrate could be or become a palace skelm. They delight in the wealth and status of their positions, garbing themselves in ornate finery that reflects their station.

Palace skelms ingratiate themselves with powerful individuals and gather followers by stoking fears of losing long-held or hard-earned power-especially power gained through illicit means. They undermine their enemies by encouraging competition, jealousy, and outright paranoia by way of magic and false messages. These skelms possess an unnatural ability to twist spoken words and worm their manipulative magic into others' speech, sowing confusion and hatred that might explode into violence.

A political upheaval is a palace skelm's greatest fear and opportunity alike, upsetting the balance of power he has built but providing countless new opportunities to sow hatred and evil. This conflicting goal leads palace skelms to self-sabotage and undermine their own efforts more than any other skelm.

Rage-filled skelms are drawn to any settlement with more than a few hundred souls. Using magical disguises and leveraging societal norms to their benefit, these antlered monsters crave fearful respect and brutally punish any who dare disagree with their lofty opinions, even in the slightest degree. Although quite dangerous on their own, skelms are at their deadliest when leading an angry mob. Their cruel and exploitative nature has made their name synonymous with villainy.

An existing skelm can transform any evil humanoid who's overwhelmed with rage into one of their kind. Skelms heap enraging humiliation on potential new brothers as a form of indoctrination, convincing these recruits that some other person or group is responsible for their misery. This practice ensures skelms begin their new existence with sufficient vitriol to plot their revenge.

Many newly forged skelms carry on their lives in the roles they held as mortals; and in fact, these roles often shape the type of skelm they become. Skelms can arise among members of nearly any ancestry, though they're more common among cultures with deeply entrenched gender roles, unjust hierarchies, and those that don't offer healthy ways to experience and process anger.

NCFt2ltSfGTesan4.name: -2 to All Saves vs. Emotion Effects

xvKXt3hrhkReIqhL.name: Corrupt Speech
xvKXt3hrhkReIqhL.description:
Trigger The skelm hears a creature speak within 30 feet

Effect The skelm sows paranoia by putting treacherous words on another's lips. The skelm whispers up to 12 words and attempts a @Check[deception|defense:perception] check against the Perception DC of a creature other than the triggering creature within 30 feet.

Critical Success The target hears the skelm's words as if they were spoken by the triggering creature. This can alter linguistic effects. The skelm also casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Mkbq9xlAUxHUHyR2]{Paranoia} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.qwlh6aDgi86U3Q7H]{Suggestion} on the target, if he likes.

Success As critical success, except the skelm can't cast paranoia or suggestion.

Failure The target doesn't hear the skelm's words, and they have no effect.

Critical Failure The target hears the skelm speak the words.

NO4hZxcJ6X16f4Og.name: Change Shape
NO4hZxcJ6X16f4Og.description:
The palace skelm can take on the appearance of any Medium male humanoid. This doesn't change his Speed or his attack and damage bonuses with his Strikes but might change the damage type his Strikes deal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

AXuWafDpkZy5SX8V.name: Incite Violence
AXuWafDpkZy5SX8V.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The skelm gives an impassioned speech calling for his followers to act upon their convictions. Each creature within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} must attempt a @Check[will|dc:24] save.

Critical Success The creature can immediately Strike an adjacent creature of its choosing.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature immediately Strikes an adjacent creature; if multiple creatures are adjacent, the skelm chooses the target. If no creatures are adjacent, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} with the skelm until the start of its next turn.

Bloody Barber Gang Leader.name: Bloody Barber Gang Leader
Bloody Barber Gang Leader.description:
Cutthroats, killers, thieves, and toughs prey upon the vulnerable of society. Directing their activities and keeping them in line are the duties of the gang leader.

Villains pursue selfish and cruel goals, trampling over anyone foolish or purehearted enough to stand in their way.

kSd8rIlnXiVczYg0.name: Deny Advantage
kSd8rIlnXiVczYg0.description: The gang leader isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to creatures of 7th level or lower that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected}, flanking, or using surprise attack.

Ht7knXtXeyTkKi2n.name: Evasion
Ht7knXtXeyTkKi2n.description: When the gang leader rolls a success on a Reflex save, they get a critical success instead.

fp3XmyB0pcpjCBex.name: Nimble Dodge
fp3XmyB0pcpjCBex.description:
Trigger The gang leader is targeted with an attack by an attacker they can see

Effect The gang leader gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

qNEPB3RKC3SlV4YE.name: Surprise Attack
qNEPB3RKC3SlV4YE.description: On the first round of combat, if the gang leader rolls Deception or Stealth for initiative, creatures who haven't acted are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the gang leader.

wXgvnztT7r9jO7Px.name: Brutal Rally
wXgvnztT7r9jO7Px.description:
Trigger The gang leader rolls a critical hit against a creature

Effect All allies that can see the gang leader gain a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls until the start of the gang leader's next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.7x0O2GqWBJiAk5PF]{Effect: Brutal Rally}

dlhm2yJ4EUGym0CG.name: Gang Up
dlhm2yJ4EUGym0CG.description: Any enemy is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the gang leader's melee attacks due to flanking as long as the enemy is within melee reach of both the gang leader and one of the gang leader's allies.

PDidp7qMSw5qRoXU.name: Quick Draw
PDidp7qMSw5qRoXU.description: The gang leader @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pvQ5rY2zrtPI614F]{Interacts} to draw a weapon, then Strikes with that weapon.

j1wf4dSXkGypJjRs.name: Sneak Attack
j1wf4dSXkGypJjRs.description: The gang leader deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Elite Smokesight Stalker Wight.name: Elite Smokesight Stalker Wight
Elite Smokesight Stalker Wight.description:
Often found lurking in the dark, prowler wights wield subterfuge as their greatest weapon. They frequently feign death in old sewers, graveyards, and mausoleums, waiting for hapless victims to pass by before striking.

Wights are undead beings of spite who primarily stalk places related to death.

eKywctiCAKPJmG5h.name: Smoke Vision
eKywctiCAKPJmG5h.description: The stalker wight ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

xicsjt4e3glrfz9g.name: Final Spite
xicsjt4e3glrfz9g.description:
Trigger The stalker wight is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect The stalker wight makes a Strike before being destroyed. They don't gain any temporary HP from drain life on this Strike.

TDyZOrJxLY1hcPKJ.name: Drain Life
TDyZOrJxLY1hcPKJ.description: When the stalker wight damages a living creature using an unarmed attack or their bound weapon, they gain 8 temporary Hit Points, and the creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:24] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. Further damage dealt by the stalker wight's unarmed and bound weapon attacks increases the value of the drained condition by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of drained 4.

apx5l6z5p09xanhv.name: Feign Death
apx5l6z5p09xanhv.description: The stalker wight quenches the telltale red glow in their eye sockets, falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, and lies completely still. Until the next time they act, the prowler wight appears to be an ordinary corpse. They have an automatic result of 37 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as an ordinary corpse.

56PK7jsheqUjQAKo.name: Sneak Attack
56PK7jsheqUjQAKo.description: The stalker wight deals an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

7499bjv6f655br8n.name: Spawn Stalker Wight
7499bjv6f655br8n.description: A living humanoid killed by a stalker wight's weapon or claw Strike rises as a stalker wight spawn after [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. This spawn is under the command of the stalker wight that killed them. They don't have drain life or spawn stalker wight and are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for as long as they're a stalker wight spawn. If the creator of the stalker wight spawn dies, the stalker wight spawn becomes a fully autonomous stalker wight; they regain their free will, gain drain life and spawn stalker wight, and are no longer clumsy

Elven Fence.name: Elven Fence
Elven Fence.description:
The longer criminals hold on to stolen loot, the greater the chance they will get caught. Fences make themselves indispensable in the underworld by paying for stolen goods in order to resell them later, whether through a seemingly legitimate business or to a closed group of elite buyers.

Some criminals are the desperate who have no option but to break the law to survive, while others choose a life of crime for thrills, forming gangs or underworld guilds that specialize in certain illegal ventures.

blPj44XSQdjiu1MS.name: Fence's Eye
blPj44XSQdjiu1MS.description: Fences live by their ability to recognize a viable trade. They can use Underworld Lore to identify an item's value and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.eReSHVEPCsdkSL4G]{Identify Magic} on an item. They gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Underworld Lore checks when doing so, and to Underworld Lore checks to determine whether an item was stolen, whether a stolen item would be too recognizable to easily move, and who would be interested in purchasing such an item.

cMz56RGF3H0a0ZQi.name: Quick Rummage
cMz56RGF3H0a0ZQi.description: The fence always has a few items close at hand. The fence @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pvQ5rY2zrtPI614F]{Interacts} to draw a weapon or item that takes a single action to activate, and then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VjxZFuUXrCU94MWR]{Strikes} with the weapon or activates the item.

0WoLHxcEDfHig6LB.name: Scoundrel's Feint
0WoLHxcEDfHig6LB.description: When the fence successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feints}, their target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the fence's attacks until the end of the fence's next turn. On a critical success, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against all attacks until the end of the fence's next turn.

ttSdjINAYV0VxPZk.name: Sneak Attack
ttSdjINAYV0VxPZk.description: The fence deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Growling Shadow Drake.name: Growling Shadow Drake
Growling Shadow Drake.description: Shadow drakes are typically among the smallest and least powerful of their species. Most stand as tall and long as house cats and have charcoal-colored scales and membranous wings just translucent enough to pass for shadows. Attracted to shiny materials, they employ deception, teamwork, and even rudimentary traps to create opportunities to make off with ill-gotten gains. Shadow drakes have a particular fascination and admiration for umbral dragons-a notable exception to the norm for drakes and dragons.

QNy9Hrx2ib5tkQKt.name: Shadow Blend
QNy9Hrx2ib5tkQKt.description: The shadow drake's form shifts and blends reflexively with surrounding shadows. A shadow drake gains an additional reaction each round, but it can use this reaction only for Shadow Evade.

0VNX7MbrCqRSKYkE.name: Shadow Evade
0VNX7MbrCqRSKYkE.description:
Trigger A creature attacks the shadow drake while it is in an area of dim light

Effect The shadow drake further obscures its position. The attacker must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:11] check in order to affect the shadow drake, as if the drake were @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} for the triggering attack.

wnZi8QCOMG86Db4l.name: Draconic Frenzy
wnZi8QCOMG86Db4l.description: The shadow drake makes one bite Strike and two tail Strikes in any order.

usIKpszaYrCWfN8r.name: Shadow Breath
usIKpszaYrCWfN8r.description:
A shadow drake spits a ball of black liquid that explodes into a cloud of frigid black shadow. This attack has a range of 40 feet and explodes in a 5-foot-radius burst. Creatures within the burst take @Damage[(3d6-4)[cold]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:16|basic] save). The explosion of shadow also snuffs out mundane light sources the size of a torch, lantern, or smaller, and attempts to counteract magical light with a +10 counteract modifier.

The shadow drake can't use Shadow Breath again for [[/r 1d6]] rounds.

5IixHzakyftZgS0g.name: Speed Surge
5IixHzakyftZgS0g.description:
Frequency three times per day

Effect The shadow drake Strides or Flies twice.

Fey-Touched Great Wolf.name: Fey-Touched Great Wolf
Fey-Touched Great Wolf.description:
Much larger and more foul-tempered than their common cousins, dire wolves haunt primeval lands that accommodate their massive size and proportionately large hunting grounds and appetites. Orcs are fond of using dire wolves as mounts, finding their vicious tempers perfect for hunting and warfare.

Wolves roam forests, hills, and other wild lands, where they hunt in packs to beleaguer and surround their prey before going in for the kill. Like most predatory animals, wolves prefer to attack the weakest or most vulnerable prey they can find.

BXPL0U3regJoMDWt.name: Sudden Charge
BXPL0U3regJoMDWt.description: The great wolf Strides twice and makes a melee Strike.

UdQXCxa42ejTiM2E.name: Tickle Bite
UdQXCxa42ejTiM2E.description: The fey-touched great wolf makes a jaws Strike. If successful, after taking the normal damage from the Strike, the target must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:22] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 minute as it becomes overcome with fits of laughter.

u7v9LREhfpqv47ed.name: Topiary
u7v9LREhfpqv47ed.description: Until the next time it acts, the fey-touched great wolf appears to be a topiary in the shape of a wolf. It has an automatic result of 37 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as a bush.

M0BuH1pWhtWsVIYm.name: Worry
M0BuH1pWhtWsVIYm.description:
Requirements The great wolf has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} with its jaws

Effect The great wolf shakes the grabbed creature with its teeth, dealing @Damage[(2d8+4)[piercing]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:25|basic] save).

IxZJIkZ5XQ9BwO3l.name: Accursed Claws
IxZJIkZ5XQ9BwO3l.description: Sounrel's claws carry her mother's hag magic. When she critically hits with a claw Strike, the target takes an additional @Damage[1d4[persistent,mental]] damage.

cVNNBjTmEEyKPfsI.name: Overburden
cVNNBjTmEEyKPfsI.description:
Requirements The infested clockwork heap's last action was a success with an infested touch Strike

Effect A fragment of the infesting spirit attaches to the target's clothing or armor, making the creature encumbered. The encumbered condition from Overburden disappears when the infested clockwork is destroyed or after 10 minutes, whichever comes first.

S804GvKh0CKfjBk5.name: Scrap Tempest
S804GvKh0CKfjBk5.description: The infested clockwork heap unleashes a cloud of loosely connected debris that whirls around its body at incredible speed. Each creature within @Template[burst|distance:30]{30 feet} takes @Damage[3d8[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:25|basic]).

jxmONdR97WrExGJ9.name: Unfinished
jxmONdR97WrExGJ9.description: Vrisk's smooth head does not have ears, so he's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deaf}. He automatically critically fails any Perception checks that require hearing and is immune to auditory effects. He can supply verbal components for casting spells and command components for activating magic items, but if he performs an action he isn't accustomed to that involves auditory elements, he must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:5] or the action is lost. He has both the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.aAoFc10cOpxGypOY]{Sign Language} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.yUuU9xyotrpwpTyC]{Read Lips} skill feats.

IrJCzZfE66Y6S88d.name: Golem Antimagic
IrJCzZfE66Y6S88d.description:
Harmed by void (@Damage[2d8[untyped]], @Damage[1d8[untyped]] from areas or persistent damage); healed by vitality (area @Damage[1d6[healing]] HP); slowed by emotion

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.GolemAntimagic]

HbVNA1Ibe1obOwtL.name: Vulnerable to Daze
HbVNA1Ibe1obOwtL.description: Vrisk is affected by the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4gBIw4IDrSfFHik4]{Daze} spell as if he was a living creature

xVhkhzcrxHeGPBV8.name: Vulnerable to Redact
xVhkhzcrxHeGPBV8.description: If targeted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.ifXNOhtmU4fKL68v]{Redact} or any other spell that erases text, Vrisk must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:18] save or immediately die as the rune on his forehead is erased.

Pups.name: Pups
Pups.description: Bonds of loyalty that endure beyond death reanimate pets to crawl from their graves within days of dying, returning to the side of their past owners, family, or pack. Unfortunately, death irrevocably changes a risen pet. They return as aggressive, predatory beasts, difficult to control and easy to anger. Even the most friendly and docile of pets becomes sadistic and violent in undeath—fixating first on those it views as competition for the attention of its owners. When a risen pet is jilted, rebuffed, or offended by its owner, it turns on them.

83mbwwys64b7tvby.name: Sense Companion
83mbwwys64b7tvby.description: Pups knows the direction of its past owner or family (as long as they're both on the same plane), but not the distance.

pcv2wjgq3skfdwr1.name: Stench
pcv2wjgq3skfdwr1.description: 10 feet. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:14] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for as long as it's sickened on a critical failure). While within the aura, affected creatures take a -2 circumstance penalty to saves against disease and to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

2ynj848nvp9c3igy.name: Betray the Living
2ynj848nvp9c3igy.description: Pups' Strikes deal 1d4 additional damage to living creatures.

Smokesight Stalker Wight.name: Smokesight Stalker Wight
Smokesight Stalker Wight.description:
Often found lurking in the dark, prowler wights wield subterfuge as their greatest weapon. They frequently feign death in old sewers, graveyards, and mausoleums, waiting for hapless victims to pass by before striking.

Wights are undead beings of spite who primarily stalk places related to death.

eKywctiCAKPJmG5h.name: Smoke Vision
eKywctiCAKPJmG5h.description: The stalker wight ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

xicsjt4e3glrfz9g.name: Final Spite
xicsjt4e3glrfz9g.description:
Trigger The stalker wight is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect The stalker wight makes a Strike before being destroyed. They don't gain any temporary HP from drain life on this Strike.

TDyZOrJxLY1hcPKJ.name: Drain Life
TDyZOrJxLY1hcPKJ.description: When the stalker wight damages a living creature using an unarmed attack or their bound weapon, they gain 7 temporary Hit Points, and the creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:22] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. Further damage dealt by the stalker wight's unarmed and bound weapon attacks increases the value of the drained condition by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of drained 4.

apx5l6z5p09xanhv.name: Feign Death
apx5l6z5p09xanhv.description: The stalker wight quenches the telltale red glow in their eye sockets, falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, and lies completely still. Until the next time they act, the prowler wight appears to be an ordinary corpse. They have an automatic result of 35 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as an ordinary corpse.

56PK7jsheqUjQAKo.name: Sneak Attack
56PK7jsheqUjQAKo.description: The stalker wight deals an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

7499bjv6f655br8n.name: Spawn Stalker Wight
7499bjv6f655br8n.description: A living humanoid killed by a stalker wight's weapon or claw Strike rises as a stalker wight spawn after [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. This spawn is under the command of the stalker wight that killed them. They don't have drain life or spawn stalker wight and are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for as long as they're a stalker wight spawn. If the creator of the stalker wight spawn dies, the stalker wight spawn becomes a fully autonomous stalker wight; they regain their free will, gain drain life and spawn stalker wight, and are no longer clumsy

Tc5o5564SP3uo9La.name: Caustic Drool
Tc5o5564SP3uo9La.description:
Caustic saliva drips from the warhound's mouth. Until the end of its turn, the abyssal warhound's jaws Strike deals an additional 2 points of acid damage on a successful attack, or 4 points on a critical success.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.5M3RGpOuxizPM5Iy]{Effect: Caustic Drool}

mXEWjlAt8TEfNuZN.name: Caustic Vomit
mXEWjlAt8TEfNuZN.description: The abyssal warhound purebred spews acidic vomit that deals @Damage[9d6[acid]] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:40] (@Check[fortitude|dc:25|basic] save). It can't use Caustic Vomit again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Caustic Vomit]]{1d4 rounds}.

cmS0jkZKZUfUUq1P.name: Shake
cmS0jkZKZUfUUq1P.description:
Requirements The abyssal warhound's Caustic Drool ability is active

Effect The warhound shakes its head, splattering nearby creatures with caustic saliva. All creatures within 10 feet of the warhound take @Damage[5d6[acid]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:23|basic]) and the warhound's Caustic Drool ability ends. Abyssal warhounds are immune to this damage.

umW6sLAsqUGufx1s.name: Warning Growl
umW6sLAsqUGufx1s.description:
Trigger A creature targets the warhound with a melee Strike

Effect The warhound @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralizes} the triggering creature and does not take a penalty for not speaking a language. The results of this check occur before resolving the triggering Strike.

Elite Animate Dream (PFS 4-11).name: Elite Animate Dream (PFS 4-11)
Elite Animate Dream (PFS 4-11).description:
An animate dream coalesces from centuries of stray fragments of reverie and dream left behind as slumbering minds drift through the Dimension of Dreams. In most cases, these fragments simply disperse on their own, but when dreamers flee from nightmares back to the waking world, these fragments can take on a supernatural life of their own. They have little reasoning and intent except to seek similar fragments, absorb them, and grow. When enough of them gather together, they merge into a horrific form as an animate dream.

Individually, animate dreams can hold a wide range of appearances, but most take on rudimentary shapes akin to the living forms of the minds that spawned them. Animate dreams that rise from slumbering humanoids, the most commonly encountered, thus appear humanoid, but with distorted, nightmarish shapes that incorporate additional twisted limbs and frightening features. In these forms, animate dreams find their way out of the Dreamlands and into the waking world, only to discover they have no way of returning and suffer a relentless hunger that only new nightmares can sate.

An animate dream thrives on the terror fueled by nightmares and fear and uses its supernatural abilities to invoke such feelings in the minds of its victims, cursing its prey by creating a permanent link to that individual's dreams. Thereafter, the victim is subjected to all manner of reoccurring nightmares. As the nightmares continue, the victim finds it more and more difficult to remain awake. In the end, the victim plunges into an accursed slumber from which it cannot return. These victims provide the animate dream with the purest form of fear and are its preferred sustenance.

An animate dream can subsist on the ambient fear generated by regular nightmares, but these lesser fears aren't as satisfying, often driving the animate dream to seek out new victims. Left without a source of fear, an animate dream won't starve to death, but it will grow increasingly violent and desperate. Famished animate dreams are the ones most often encountered, as they have been forced to abandon subtlety to pursue more blatant methods of harvesting fear. Yet such animate dreams also tend to be the least powerful of their kind. Those who have grown metaphysically fat on fear have generally done so by adopting a specific nightmare theme, such as being buried alive, being swept away by ocean waves, or being consumed by wild beasts. Such animate dreams often have similarly themed innate spells to augment their powers.

hychIP30Jt5HOYED.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

pepIdjNqJtUTl9Wn.name: Endless Nightmare
pepIdjNqJtUTl9Wn.description:
An animate dream's touch fills the victim's mind with terrifying visions

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:28]

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} (1 day)

Stage 2 fatigued and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 The victim falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} and can't be awakened as long as they remain at this stage (1 day).

Bugbear Night Terror.name: Bugbear Night Terror
Bugbear Night Terror.description:
The more common bugbear thug specializes in the art of lurking in the shadows.

These stealthy and cruel goblinoid creatures delight in spreading fear and tormenting their victims. Bugbears are the monsters lurking in the closet and hiding under the bed. Preying on remote farmsteads, bugbears reveal their presence with thumps in the night or creaks of boards to build lurking dread and arouse suspicion and fear.

e8BUlHLevzRJnHEc.name: Startling Grasp
e8BUlHLevzRJnHEc.description: The bugbear Strides up to 10 feet and attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.action-macros.Macro.i95kcGLIQKOTsnv6]{Grapple: Athletics} a creature they're @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} by. If they succeed, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} if the bugbear critically succeeds at their Athletics check to Grapple.

naotn6A029XPnJc1.name: Wicked Mauler
naotn6A029XPnJc1.description: The bugbear gains a +4 circumstance bonus to damage rolls against @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} creatures.

rm5sOGU46Lbwed4O.name: Aldori Parry
rm5sOGU46Lbwed4O.description: Thisnabel gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of their next turn.

sqsHfPzCBU6rGYz1.name: Sneak Attack
sqsHfPzCBU6rGYz1.description: Thisnabel deals an extra 1d4 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

k0RsAtkhvhFKUQYb.name: Bardic Lore
k0RsAtkhvhFKUQYb.description: Revna can Recall Knowledge on any subject with a +9 modifier.

dztjl21nbBcixfct.name: Steady Spellcasting
dztjl21nbBcixfct.description: If a reaction would disrupt Revna's spellcasting action, she attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15]. If she succeeds, her action isn't disrupted.

1EsMXmB9tTK4sElQ.name: Aldori Parry
1EsMXmB9tTK4sElQ.description: Rhenei gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of their next turn.

Menacing Shadow Drake.name: Menacing Shadow Drake
Menacing Shadow Drake.description: Shadow drakes are typically among the smallest and least powerful of their species. Most stand as tall and long as house cats and have charcoal-colored scales and membranous wings just translucent enough to pass for shadows. Attracted to shiny materials, they employ deception, teamwork, and even rudimentary traps to create opportunities to make off with ill-gotten gains. Shadow drakes have a particular fascination and admiration for umbral dragons-a notable exception to the norm for drakes and dragons.

QNy9Hrx2ib5tkQKt.name: Shadow Blend
QNy9Hrx2ib5tkQKt.description: The shadow drake's form shifts and blends reflexively with surrounding shadows. A shadow drake gains an additional reaction each round, but it can use this reaction only for Shadow Evade.

0VNX7MbrCqRSKYkE.name: Shadow Evade
0VNX7MbrCqRSKYkE.description:
Trigger A creature attacks the shadow drake while it is in an area of dim light

Effect The shadow drake further obscures its position. The attacker must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:11] check in order to affect the shadow drake, as if the drake were @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} for the triggering attack.

wnZi8QCOMG86Db4l.name: Draconic Frenzy
wnZi8QCOMG86Db4l.description: The shadow drake makes one bite Strike and two tail Strikes in any order.

usIKpszaYrCWfN8r.name: Shadow Breath
usIKpszaYrCWfN8r.description:
A shadow drake spits a ball of black liquid that explodes into a cloud of frigid black shadow. This attack has a range of 40 feet and explodes in a 5-foot-radius burst. Creatures within the burst take @Damage[3d6[cold]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic] save). The explosion of shadow also snuffs out mundane light sources the size of a torch, lantern, or smaller, and attempts to counteract magical light with a +10 counteract modifier.

The shadow drake can't use Shadow Breath again for [[/r 1d6]] rounds.

5IixHzakyftZgS0g.name: Speed Surge
5IixHzakyftZgS0g.description:
Frequency three times per day

Effect The shadow drake Strides or Flies twice.

Bolger Trusk (7-8).name: Bolger Trusk (7-8)
Bolger Trusk (7-8).description:
Vampire masterminds are evil wizards who control entire cabals of the undead and instill fear in the hearts of mortals far and wide.

Vampires are undead creatures that feed on the blood of the living.
Bolger Trusk (7-8).hpdetails: coffin restoration, fast healing 10, void healing

I0GaQls3ghJMJ5Ib.name: Children of the Night
I0GaQls3ghJMJ5Ib.description:
The vampire's presence brings forth creatures of the night to do the master's bidding. These typically include @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.6wPW2dvpt86Ou6bL]{Rat Swarms}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.2mg30nJR6P3HJDSd]{Bat Swarms}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.BN5Lb6IsQ9Wyu3rL]{Wolves}, but can include other creatures.

The vampire can give telepathic orders to these creatures as long as they are within 100 feet, but they can't communicate back.

9iYmbVoVyCe6SNu9.name: Coffin Restoration
9iYmbVoVyCe6SNu9.description: Unlike other undead, a vampire isn't destroyed at 0 HP. Instead, it falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. If its body rests in its coffin for 1 hour, the vampire gains 1 HP, after which its fast healing begins to function normally.

drrpMlT2j7uEjKqs.name: Mist Evasion
drrpMlT2j7uEjKqs.description:
Trigger Bolger would take damage from a critical hit, or from critically failing a saving throw against a damaging effect.

Effect Bolger's body briefly evaporates into the surrounding mists, dispersing the triggering attack. The attack has the results of a failure instead of a critical success.

GXr4u9s0uuvI5J6d.name: Vampire Weaknesses
GXr4u9s0uuvI5J6d.description:
All vampires possess the following weaknesses.

  • Compulsions Vampires are creatures of strange and unknowable compulsions. A typical vampire can't voluntarily cross running water unless it is transported while it hides within its coffin, nor can it enter a private dwelling unless invited in by someone with the authority to do so. At your discretion, vampires might have different compulsions-a pirate vampire might not be able to set foot on solid ground without being invited, for example. The vampire can still be forced to do these things and might be able to overcome its compulsion just as it does its revulsion.
  • Revulsion A vampire can't voluntarily come within 10 feet of brandished garlic or a brandished religious symbol of a non-evil deity. To brandish garlic or a religious symbol, a creature must Interact to do so for 1 round (similar to Raising a Shield). If the vampire involuntarily comes within 10 feet of an object of its revulsion, it gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition, running from the object of its revulsion until it ends an action beyond 10 feet. After 1 round of being exposed to the subject of its revulsion, a vampire can attempt a @Check[will|dc:25|name:Overcome Revulsion] save as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. On a success, it overcomes its revulsions for [[/gmr 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds} (or 1 hour on a critical success).
  • Stake A wooden stake driven through a vampire's heart drops the vampire to 0 HP and prevents it from healing above 0 HP, even in its coffin. Staking a vampire requires three actions and works only if the vampire is unconscious. If the stake is removed, the vampire can heal above 0 HP again, and if it's in its coffin the 1-hour rest period begins once the stake is removed. If the vampire's head is severed and anointed with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.z9T4c1hXwOotsMCp]{Holy Water} while the stake is in place, the vampire is destroyed.
  • Sunlight If exposed to direct sunlight, a vampire immediately becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. The slowed value increases by 1 each time the vampire ends its turn in sunlight. If the vampire loses all its actions in this way, it is destroyed. Due to their supernatural aversion to light, vampires don't cast shadows or show a reflection in mirrors.

zEz9gGlpNBUnyF2Y.name: Change Shape
zEz9gGlpNBUnyF2Y.description:
The vampire transforms into its animal form or back into its normal form.

  • Bat The vampire changes into a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.xnpuGO8jEMba9wy5]{Giant Bat}

    • Size Large
    • Senses Echolocation 40 feet
    • Speed 20 feet, fly 30 feet
    • Melee fangs [[/r 1d20+19 #Fangs]]{+19}/[[/r 1d20+14 #Fangs]]{+14}/[[/r 1d20+9 #Fangs]]{+9}, Damage @Damage[(2d8+9)[piercing]] damage

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

czqtIybNHs8mmEeg.name: Create Spawn
czqtIybNHs8mmEeg.description:
If a creature dies after being reduced to 0 HP by Drink Blood, the vampire can turn this victim into a vampire by donating some of its own blood to the victim and burying the victim in earth for 3 nights.

If the new vampire is lower level than its creator, it is under the creator's control. If a vampire controls too many spawn at once (as determined by the GM), strong-willed spawn can free themselves by succeeding at a @Check[will|name:Escape Thralldom] saving throw against the vampire's Will DC.

3ZSVEZBMKleuEd84.name: Dominate
3ZSVEZBMKleuEd84.description:
The vampire can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate} at will as a divine innate spell. Casting it requires staring into the target's eyes, giving the spell the visual trait. The save DC uses the DC of the vampire's level, and a creature that succeeds is temporarily immune to that vampire's Dominate for 24 hours.

Fully destroying the vampire ends the domination, but merely reducing the vampire to 0 HP is insufficient to break the spell.

9ewh7tMyC0NRIpZx.name: Drain Bonded Item
9ewh7tMyC0NRIpZx.description:
Frequency Once per day.

Requirements Bolger hasn't acted yet on this turn.

Effect The vampire expends the power stored in its signet ring. This gives Bolger the ability to cast one prepared spell he had already previously cast today, without spending a spell slot. He must still Cast the Spell and meet the spell's other requirements.

HhkalK1aMfqDSiWQ.name: Drink Blood
HhkalK1aMfqDSiWQ.description:
Requirements A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or willing creature is within the vampire's reach.

Effect The vampire sinks its fangs into that creature to drink its blood. This requires an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions.

The victim is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and the vampire regains @Damage[10[healing]] Hit Points, gaining any excess HP as temporary Hit Points. Drinking Blood from a creature that's already drained doesn't restore any HP to the vampire but increases the victim's drain value by 1. A vampire can also consume blood that's been emptied into a vessel for sustenance, but it gains no HP from doing so.

A victim's drained condition decreases by 1 per week. A blood transfusion, which requires a @Check[medicine|dc:20|name:Blood Transfusion] check and sufficient blood or a blood donor, reduces the drain by 1 after 10 minutes.

DD9mP7VmHRk4Lm97.name: Steady Spellcasting
DD9mP7VmHRk4Lm97.description: If another creature's reaction would disrupt Bolger's spellcasting action, the vampire attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15] check. If he succeeds, his action isn't disrupted.

lVHVshcIoX6f8ybS.name: Unnerving Prowess
lVHVshcIoX6f8ybS.description:
Trigger Halran critically succeeds at a Strike or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} with hisAldori dueling sword.

Effect Halran attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} the target of his Strike or Disarm. This Demoralize attempt does not have the auditory trait, nor does Halran take a penalty to the check if the target doesn't understand his language.

YiAJAUnLYTzQ6ys0.name: Unnerving Prowess
YiAJAUnLYTzQ6ys0.description:
Trigger Dura critically succeeds at a Strike or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} with her Aldori dueling sword.

Effect Dura attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} the target of her Strike or Disarm. This Demoralize attempt does not have the auditory trait, nor does Dura take a penalty to the check if the target doesn't understand her language.

Grim Rictus Bridge Guard.name: Grim Rictus Bridge Guard
Grim Rictus Bridge Guard.description:
Guards are rank-and-file members of a town watch or city guard, trained to look for trouble, take down criminals, and follow orders. They are a match for only the most fledgling of adventurers and criminals, but, given time, the settlement can usually muster them in numbers sufficient to neutralize most threats.

Larger societies rely on those with the authority and the ability to interpret and enforce laws. In good-aligned societies, these officials carry out their duties fairly. In neutral and evil ones, these officials can be harsh and cruel (with an altered alignment to reflect this), imposing severe punishments on those who can't pay for mercy.

Animated Leather Armor.name: Animated Leather Armor
Animated Leather Armor.description:
Suits of animated armor see use both as guardians and as training partners in high-end martial academies able to afford the extravagance. They are most often found in wizard laboratories and ancient dungeons.

Granted a semblance of life through the use of rituals or other strange magic, animated objects take many forms and serve a variety of uses. A few examples of typical animated objects are listed below. Many of these creatures serve as guardians, surprising unsuspecting adventurers when they suddenly attack. Others serve as idle distractions for the exceptionally rich, simple servants created to handle odd jobs, and the like.

GhnXpFtWM1vyvu8V.name: Construct Armor (Hardness 3)
GhnXpFtWM1vyvu8V.description: Like normal objects, an animated leather armor has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once an animated leather armor is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 11.

Bugbear Terror.name: Bugbear Terror
Bugbear Terror.description:
The more common bugbear thug specializes in the art of lurking in the shadows.

These stealthy and cruel goblinoid creatures delight in spreading fear and tormenting their victims. Bugbears are the monsters lurking in the closet and hiding under the bed. Preying on remote farmsteads, bugbears reveal their presence with thumps in the night or creaks of boards to build lurking dread and arouse suspicion and fear.

e8BUlHLevzRJnHEc.name: Startling Grasp
e8BUlHLevzRJnHEc.description: The bugbear Strides up to 10 feet and attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.action-macros.Macro.i95kcGLIQKOTsnv6]{Grapple: Athletics} a creature they're @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} by. If they succeed, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} if the bugbear critically succeeds at their Athletics check to Grapple.

naotn6A029XPnJc1.name: Wicked Mauler
naotn6A029XPnJc1.description: The bugbear gains a +2 circumstance bonus to damage rolls against @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} creatures.

lVHVshcIoX6f8ybS.name: Unnerving Prowess
lVHVshcIoX6f8ybS.description:
Trigger Halran critically succeeds at a Strike or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} with hisAldori dueling sword.

Effect Halran attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} the target of his Strike or Disarm. This Demoralize attempt does not have the auditory trait, nor does Halran take a penalty to the check if the target doesn't understand his language.

Greater Barghest (PFS 4-07).name: Greater Barghest (PFS 4-07)
Greater Barghest (PFS 4-07).description:
Once a barghest has eaten enough to grow into a greater barghest, it typically seeks a method to leave the Material Plane and return to the Abyss, there joining other fiends as yet another of that plane's horrors. As barghests have no innate ability to travel the planes, though, the time it takes for most greater barghests to engineer such a return can usually be measured in years, if not decades. During that time, greater barghests continue to play the roles of gluttons, hunters of humanity, and tyrants of goblinoid tribes. More than a few grow accustomed to such lives on the Material Plane and wholly abandon the end goal of returning to the Abyss, despite the fact that those who do make such a return home often grow even more powerful over time, gaining eerie new abilities and qualities absorbed from the raw chaos of the Abyss itself.

In addition to greater barghests being more powerful than typical barghests, the process of transforming into a greater barghest results in hideous mutations that often grant deadly abilities. Some barghests grow large bat-like wings upon their transformation. Others develop toxic breath or vestigial limbs. The options detailed in the stats below represent only the tip of the proverbial iceberg for barghest mutations-feel free to use these as inspiration for coming up with new mutations of your own design.

Barghests are lupine fiends with goblinoid faces and humanoid hands. They stalk the Material Plane in search of souls to sate their demonic hunger. Eons ago, barghests dwelled in the pits of Hell and served Asmodeus, but after Lamashtu abducted and adopted the four most powerful of their kind to serve as pets (and in time, as a pantheon of hero-gods worshipped by evil goblins), barghests' loyalties and philosophical nature changed significantly. Today, while barghests retain their connection to goblinoids, they serve none but their own appetites.

xH2BbGjq1xhKgVdq.name: (Greater Barghest) Mutation - Wings
xH2BbGjq1xhKgVdq.description: The barghest has malformed wings extending from its back. It gains a fly Speed of 25 feet.

HzOfOnqjDdkk5Alq.name: Change Shape
HzOfOnqjDdkk5Alq.description:
The barghest takes on the shape of a goblinoid (a goblin, hobgoblin, or bugbear) or a wolf, or it transforms back into its true form. When the barghest is a goblinoid, it loses its jaws and claw Strikes, it becomes Small if it is a goblin, and its Speed changes to 20 feet. When the barghest is a wolf, its Speed changes to 40 feet and its jaws gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.BCLvAx4Pz4MLa2pu]{Knockdown}. Each individual barghest has only one goblinoid form and one wolf form.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.o6ZI01zZBQDASuaw]{Effect: Wolf Shape}

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Bugbear Bully.name: Bugbear Bully
Bugbear Bully.description: These stealthy and cruel goblinoid creatures delight in spreading fear and tormenting their victims. Bugbears are the monsters lurking in the closet and hiding under the bed. Preying on remote farmsteads, bugbears reveal their presence with thumps in the night or creaks of boards to build lurking dread and arouse suspicion and fear.

ORE3NapxjXjifDBn.name: Brute Force
ORE3NapxjXjifDBn.description: The bugbear bully strides up to half its speed and then attempts to either @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.action-macros.Macro.yNry1xMZqdWHncbV]{Shove: Athletics} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.action-macros.Macro.gRj7xUfcpUZQLrOC]{Trip: Athletics} a creature. If they critically fail, they treat the result as a failure.

hKKLqWLa3L49oSoS.name: Bully's Rage
hKKLqWLa3L49oSoS.description:
Requirements The bugbear bully has dealt damage to a creature or knocked a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} since the start of its previous turn

Effect The bully gains a +2 status bonus to Intimidation checks and damage until the end of its turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.a0nJK2mKHwWYzpdG]{Effect: Bully's Rage}

Living Boulder (PFS 4-04).name: Living Boulder (PFS 4-04)
Living Boulder (PFS 4-04).description: Living boulders roll and glide through the Plane of Earth, gathering gemstones and metal shards until their surfaces resemble a ship's hull covered in barnacles. Barely more intelligent than many animals, living boulders fill much the same role on the Plane of Earth as the great herd animals found on Material Plane worlds.

1fTRsJAGDuFgPeXF.name: Earth Glide
1fTRsJAGDuFgPeXF.description: A living boulder can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.H6v1VgowHaKHnVlG]{Burrow} through earthen matter, including rock. When it does so, it moves at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing.

MJIrkULpmp4soA0F.name: Rolling Charge
MJIrkULpmp4soA0F.description: The living boulder Strides twice, and can then make a Strike with its jaws. This jaws Strike gains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.BCLvAx4Pz4MLa2pu]{Knockdown}.

SIlsfeJHorbIUO9o.name: Barbed Net
SIlsfeJHorbIUO9o.description: When a crumbling automaton hits a creature with their barbed net, the net wraps around the target, which becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and takes a -10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds. If the Strike was a critical success, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}. When a creature Escapes (DC 17), or if the Strike misses, the net crumbles into nothing. Each time a creature attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape}, it takes @Damage[1d6[slashing]] damage from the net's barbs, regardless of whether the attempt succeeds.

Stabilized Ochre Jelly.name: Stabilized Ochre Jelly
Stabilized Ochre Jelly.description: Slimes, molds, and other oozes can be found in dank dungeons and shadowed forests. While not necessarily evil, some grow to enormous sizes and have insatiable appetites.

MwXQ4IgNkQaCxTcf.name: Motion Sense 60 feet
MwXQ4IgNkQaCxTcf.description: A ochre jelly can sense nearby motion through vibration and air movement.

3bBspnRqJCqpS3uk.name: Splorch
3bBspnRqJCqpS3uk.description:
Trigger An adjacent creature hits the ochre jelly with a Strike that would deal slashing or piercing damage

Effect A gout of acidic jelly shoots out at the attacker. The attacker must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:22] save.

Critical Success The attacker is unaffected.
